Title: Livestream Business Data Analyst #UrgentHire
Description: Responsibilities Establish analytical framework for the TikTok Live streaming team: root cause analysis, core metrics monitoring, and automated dashboards to surface key data insights to stakeholders and inform product strategies. Evaluate and forecast the impact of product features on creators, agencies, operation and the TikTok ecosystem. Dive deep into the data to understand how creator, 3rd parties, and viewer behaviors change with the evolution of our product. Understand top performers and use data to explore and analyze actionable operational strategies. Act as our team's thought leader on best practices and move towards a long-term vision of sustainable and thriving data processes. Work hand-in-hand with operation, product, engineering, and design to proactively influence and inform teammates' decisions throughout the business lifecycle. Qualifications Bachelor degree or above, major in mathematics, statistics, computer science is preferred; or major in science or engineering or engaged in data statistics, analysis, modeling related working areas after graduation. 5+ years of domain experience in a mobile or consumer internet business, or in a high-velocity, high-growth product or team. Data analysis ability, familiar with Hive SQL, Python, R. Familiarity of machine learning Knowledge will be a plus. Familiar with statistics and dashboard, preferred to have experience in user growth, metrics creation, A/B testing, and data modeling. An impact-oriented, customer-centric approach to data analysis; Exceptional analysis, communication, and strategy report writing skills. Has a “can-do” attitude with a strong sense of ownership to execute end-to-end projects. Self-driven and able to manage and balance ongoing requests with proper prioritization.

Title: Human Resource (Payroll Officer, Data Analyst)
Description: Oversees, executes and ensures compliance on (but not limited to) the following day-to-day payroll processes: Responsible for monthly full payroll cycle of 500 headcounts including payroll processing, payroll reconciliation, reports. Monitor and manage payroll legislation compliance. Manage in-house time attendance records and Interface with payroll. Responsible for statutory payment submission and claims - CPF, FWL, IRAS (IR21, IR8A), NS claims, Government-Paid maternity, Paternity and childcare Leave, Mediation (TADM), etc. Maintain and upkeep employee records in HR system and Personnel File (P-File). Research emerging market trends and changes in the regulatory environment, conduct external and internal research and summarize results for management review to support compliance work. Support ad-hoc project work and provide analysis to enhance the effectiveness of the overall HR function and business performance. Research employee benefits in similar industries and advise on changes/updates to the company’s existing benefits or policies. Foster positive and cordial working relationships with both internal and external stakeholders. Requirement Possess Degree/Diploma in Human Resource Management or in any discipline with at least 2 years of relevant experience in HR function. Good knowledge on Employment Act, MOM regulations and tax regulations. Proficiency in Microsoft Office Applications Knowledge of TimeSoft and E-Cirtrix will be an added advantage. Detail oriented, able to maintain confidentiality and work independently. Proactive, able to multi-task and work in a fast paced environment. Good interpersonal skills, accountable, initiative and willingness to learn. Good team player with positive working attitude. Strategic thinking & strong analytical skills. Working Hours : 5-days (Mon-Fri 8.15am – 5.30pm)

Title: E-commerce Data Analyst #JobsThatMatter
Description: Responsibilities: The e-commerce industry has seen tremendous growth in recent years and has become a hotly contested space amongst leading Internet companies, and its future growth cannot be underestimated. With millions of loyal users globally, we believe TikTok is an ideal platform to deliver a brand new and better e-commerce experience to our users. We are looking for passionate and talented people to join our product and operations team, together we can build an e-commerce ecosystem that is innovative, secure and intuitive for our users. Overall responsible for data support of e-commerce overseas operation module; Daily output and follow up the data output of the whole operation and each module; Operation core index design, data dashboard design landing, core index data abnormal monitoring; Data analysis and follow-up of operation activities in overseas countries; In depth analysis of business, user, commodity and other data, and provide to the operation team to support the operation strategy; Follow up the local operation work overseas, support the operation effect and give the follow-up optimization suggestions; Cooperate with product / operation / R & D, promote the implementation of optimization scheme, and bring about the actual improvement and growth of business; Responsible for all kinds of a / b experiment design and analysis; Analysis of the overall overseas market and business operation of a certain country. Qualifications: Bachelor degree or above, major in mathematics, statistics, computer is preferred; or major in science or engineering or engaged in data statistics, analysis, modeling related working areas after graduation； Proficient in SQL, can use Python or R for data analysis； At least 3 years of working experience in e-commerce business and analysis is preferred； Overseas business experience or analytical experience is preferred； Able to write requirement documents in English and communicate with global staff; Have a strong learning ability and curiosity; ability to pick up domain knowledge in new areas quickly; Can lead a small project team to support business; Have a strong ability to work under pressure, have the courage to overcome difficulties and accept challenges.

Title: Ecommerce Anti-Fraud Data Analyst #Urgent
Description: Responsibilities Why Join Us TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo. At TikTok, our people are humble, intelligent, compassionate and creative. We create to inspire - for you, for us, and for more than 1 billion users on our platform. We lead with curiosity and aim for the highest, never shying away from taking calculated risks and embracing ambiguity as it comes. Here, the opportunities are limitless for those who dare to pursue bold ideas that exist just beyond the boundary of possibility. Join us and make impact happen with a career at TikTok. The TikTok E-commerce Governance and Experience team is responsible for ensuring our marketplace is safe and trustworthy for users, sellers, and creators globally. We value user satisfaction and work on policies, rules, and systems to ensure quality for our community. As the Anti-fraud analyst, you will be responsible for building, improving, and monitoring business processes that detect and prevent fraudulent activities in various scenarios including transactions, KYC, and seller-creator affiliation. Apply investigational skills to monitor, audit, and analyze potential fraudulent cases and produce root cause analysis report with value-added risk mitigation suggestions; Collaborate with product managers, data scientists, and the engineering team to evaluate the efficiency of existing tools, processes, and policies related to fraud management; Understand the trends and intelligence of fraudulent activities in each local market and build intelligence systems to mitigate fraud; Define key performance metrics and build detailed reporting models for effective tracking, reporting, and feedback on measures implemented; Drive process implementation and improvement that streamlines determination of resellers, incentive abuse, and/or fake order evaluation; Communicate findings and complex results to key stakeholders and manage timeline of mitigation projects. Qualifications Bachelor's degree or above with a background in Computer Science, Business Analytic, Math, Statistics, or related field ; Strong data analysis and correlation skills with ability to work through complex and unfamiliar data sets and able to derive the characteristics of different scenarios; Comfortable in a matrix organization and to drive cross-functional and cross-regional collaborations; Strong attention to detail and ability to notice discrepancies in data; Experience with SQL and analytical tools (SAS, R, Python) is a must; Experience with AI and machine learning is a plus; Familiarity with risk and fraud in Ecommerce fields is a strong plus; Past experience working in SEA or EU market is highly preferred; Proficiency in English is required; any second language proficiency is highly preferred but not required. TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

Title: Data Analyst (Risk Control), Global Payments
Description: Responsibilities Founded in 2012, ByteDance's mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. With a suite of more than a dozen products, including TikTok, Helo, and Resso, as well as platforms specific to the China market, including Toutiao, Douyin, and Xigua, ByteDance has made it easier and more fun for people to connect with, consume, and create content. Why Join Us At ByteDance, our people are humble, intelligent, compassionate and creative. We create to inspire - for you, for us, and for millions of users across all of our products. We lead with curiosity and aim for the highest, never shying away from taking calculated risks and embracing ambiguity as it comes. Here, the opportunities are limitless for those who dare to pursue bold ideas that exist just beyond the boundary of possibility. Join us and make impact happen with a career at ByteDance. The Global Payments team provides professional payment solutions with smooth functioning of payment channels to all global businesses of ByteDance to support the expansion and growth of ByteDance’s global businesses. Global payments has offices including: Beijing, Shanghai , Shenzhen, Hangzhou , Singapore and Mountain View. Global Payments Data Intelligence Risk Control team's works to minimise the frequency and damage of inauthentic behaviours in supporting international businesses (TikTok Live, TikTok Shop, Resso) with a data-driven approach. For example, this team is focused on optimising key payment metrics including but not limited to: fraud rate, chargeback rate, compliance rate, etc, through data intelligence approach to provide quality values to our customers. Our Global Payments Risk Control team mission is: To protect ByteDance users who are using Global Payments' service, including live stream creators and users, e-commerce buyers and sellers; To provide a safe payment experience on our platforms by securing the integrity of our payments ecosystem, building infrastructures, platforms and technologies To collaborate with multiple cross-functional teams and stakeholders to provide exceptional values to our customers In this team, you'll be exposed to unique opportunities and experience first-hand exposure to company strategies in key security initiatives. Some examples are building scalable and robust, privacy-safe and intelligence, secure product and customer friendly systems and solutions. You'll be part of a team that's developing novel solutions to first-seen challenges in a fast paced environment of a phenomenal product eco-system. If you are looking for a fast paced environment and able to make real impact to businesses and customers, this role is for you. Responsibilities Identify, investigate, and communicate risks in the Global Payments ecosystem; Discover risk trends and behaviour patterns from big data sets; Conduct data analysis of risk cases and design long-term solutions; Provide insights to optimise risk strategies to create business values. Qualifications Bachelor's degree or above in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics or other related majors; Proficient in big data tools such as SQL / Hive / Spark; Domain experiences in one of these fields is preferred: trust and safety, risk management, fraud, anti-fraud, etc. Be Data-sensitive, with strong data analysis and problem-solving skills, and strong data-driven sense; Ability to communicate and influence across teams and regions; ability to find win-win solutions that meet the objectives of cross-functional partners while reducing risks ByteDance is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At ByteDance, our mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

Title: Funds Data Analyst Early Professional Program (Bahasa Indonesia Speaker) - Singapore
Description: At Bloomberg, our products are motivated by powerful information. We combine data and context to paint the whole picture for our clients, around the clock – from around the world. In Bloomberg Data, we’re responsible for delivering this data, news and analytics through innovative technology - quickly and accurately. The Team: Bloomberg’s Funds Data team is looking for an analyst to join its growing Fund Onboarding team. There are around half a million funds in the market, each with various structures and characteristics to meet the unique needs of investors. As part of the team, you’ll work alongside a Team Leader to use your knowledge of the dataset to improve our fund onboarding procedures. This includes, but is not limited to, configuring ETL pipelines, speaking publicly with contributors to ensure accurate data ingestion from fund inception, and contribute business rules and quality workflows to ensure high data accuracy. This is in addition to maintaining and growing a knowledge of funds data process and client engagement. The Role:We’ll trust you to: Acquire, update & maintain high-quality funds data using various internal systems, proprietary company software and your own automation knowledge Work with domain experts to enrich the product using technical tools Establish and manage relationships with internal groups throughout Bloomberg as well as external clients Maintain a solid grasp of the fund data space by processing data for your assigned fund coverage and answering client questions Work with other data and core business groups, such as Product, Sales, News and Engineering to help develop and improve product databases and functionality across the terminal Leverage knowledge of the funds dataset to configure workflows in a production environment using Bloomberg’s data processing technologies This is an entry level role where you’ll need to have: The ability to join a training class in 2023 No more than 2 years of work experience Experience working in asset management and/or finance industry Experience in data management, data processing, or data analysis Experience in a client facing, stakeholder management, or consulting role preferably in the finance industry Demonstrated project management skills and strong organization skills with ability to balance multiple projects simultaneously Ability to think critically in improving and developing products Growing curiosity about the world of data and using data to drive actions Solid attention to detail and experience in logical thinking & problem solving through school/work/internship Ability to communicate effectively and articulate thought process clearly Business proficiency and fluency in English & Bahasa Indonesia to manage the respective clients We’d love to see: 1-2 years work experience in asset management and/or finance industry Experience with the Funds Market and strong knowledge of the key concepts for this product Demonstrated proficiency with Git, SQL, and Python through work experience and/or projects Prior experience configuring or developing microservices in a business environment. Certified Data Management Professional (CDMP) designation Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA) designation Previous work experience with the Bloomberg Terminal, or Bloomberg Market Concepts (BMC) certification Does this sound like you? This is an entry level role. Apply if you think we're a good match. Please note this is a two-stage application process, following the submission of your candidate details you will receive an email with directions to complete an online assessment. Your application will not be complete until you have submitted the assessment. In the meantime, feel free to have a look at this: https://www.bloomberg.com/careers/global-data/ Bloomberg is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of age, ancestry, color, gender identity or expression, genetic predisposition or carrier status, marital status, national or ethnic origin, race, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation, sexual and other reproductive health decisions, parental or caring status, physical or mental disability, pregnancy or parental leave, protected veteran status, status as a victim of domestic violence, or any other classification protected by applicable law. Bloomberg is a disability inclusive employer. Please let us know if you require any reasonable adjustments to be made for the recruitment process.

Title: Data Analyst #Urgent
Description: Responsibilities About TikTok TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo. Why Join Us At TikTok, our people are humble, intelligent, compassionate and creative. We create to inspire - for you, for us, and for more than 1 billion users on our platform. We lead with curiosity and aim for the highest, never shying away from taking calculated risks and embracing ambiguity as it comes. Here, the opportunities are limitless for those who dare to pursue bold ideas that exist just beyond the boundary of possibility. Join us and make impact happen with a career at TikTok. About the Team The DCC Data Science team within Monetization Integrity (MI) is seeking bright and endlessly curious data experts to help manage huge amounts of unstructured and structured data, in order to turn this content into business insights and also prepare it for machine learning. This group turns huge amounts of unstructured and structured data content into business insights and leverages machine learning to improve the customer experience and advertiser engagement. About the Role We expect you to have strong experience working with unstructured and structured data, to demonstrate clear communication, and to possess a strong desire to execute and best-in-class craftsmanship. You will spend part of your time on technical work and the other part collaborating cross-functionally with partners in product and engineering, to ensure TikTok scales in the most safe and compliant way. What You'll Need - Proficiency with databases and SQL expertise. Experience with large-scale data warehousing architecture and data modeling. Expertise with data processing (ETL) technologies is required. Experience in one programming language such as Java, Scala, or Python. Strong analytical skills. - Aptitude to independently learn new technologies. If need be, act as a leader to drive big efforts with other data analysts. What You'll Do Drive clarity and solve ambiguous, challenging business problems using data-driven approaches. Propose and own data analysis (including modeling, coding, analytics, and experimentation) to drive business insight and facilitate decisions. Dig into complex data sets and make sense out of them. Translate functional and technical requirements into architecture and design. Participate in code and design reviews to maintain high development standards. Measure business performance, develop core metrics and create dashboards to track and understand them. Identify data, metrics and analyses needs for business partners. Initiate, develop and maintain data pipelines and data models that power dashboards and data products with outstanding craftsmanship. Perform deep analyses and build models to understand customer behavior, and extract key insights that impact product decisions. Title: Manager, Learning Data Analyst - (220002YF)
Description: About Us: At OCBC, our greatest pride is seeing our people succeed. OCBC Campus contributes to this goal by pulling together the best minds to inspire a future ready workforce, while building a culture where our people learn and thrive to reach their potential! Future Smart was launched in 2018, with the aim to leave no one behind as OCBC grows and transforms. We focus on equipping employees with the necessary competencies so that they can be at their best in their current or new roles. [Visit our Career Page to find out more: Careers at OCBC/ Follow us on LinkedIn and/or Facebook for latest updates About the Role: Human capital has been cited as an emerging important variable in determining organisational effectiveness, which thus gives rise to increasing pressures for Human Resources (HR) teams to play a key role in developing and implementing corporate strategy and to become a high value-added part of an organisation. In order to succeed in this new role, one development area for HR is to build analytic and databased decision-making capability that are needed to influence business strategy (Lawler et al., 2004). We are looking for someone passionate in People Capability Analytics & Design (Learning) to join the OCBC Campus team. You will have a chance to drive a data-driven decision-making culture at HR to strengthen the bridge between Learning and Business Outcomes. Reporting to the Head, Learning Technology, Data & Design in the Learning & Development (L&D) team, you will be supporting the continual enhancements to Group L&D metrics and reporting underpinned by a strong Learning Organisation culture, to support the Bank’s business objectives and commitment to people development. Specific Responsibilities for this Role: Uplifts of Learning Metrics and Dashboard Increase utilisation of learning metrics and dashboard by uplifting Data accuracy Data visualisation Metric validation Support the development of good data governance in managing learning data across different sources and entities Collaborate with HR team members (especially Learning Business Partners and HR Analytics team), Divisions and external parties to achieve uplifts in metrics and dashboard Drive Data-Driven Decision-Making Culture Driven by Data to distil insights to improve learners’ experience, design & review of learning initiatives as well as guide Divisions and Managers in developing learning interventions. Upskill internal capabilities in communicating with data-driven insights. This may include planning and rolling out of change management processes. Develop Branded Content to Showcase OCBC as a Thought-Leader in Learning Support in conceptualising and execution of strategic events and branding campaigns, leveraging on key research insights, to establish OCBC’s brand as a Learning Organisation, Talent Developer and Thought Leadership in the space of Learning & Transformation. Collaborate with external stakeholders (e.g. vendors, industry practitioners, academia etc) in the successful implementation of the events and campaigns Develop, curate and present engaging and creative content (including digital content) together with internal Marketing team and external partners using a variety of tools to support OCBC campus in its branding and communication efforts Manage internal OCBC-wide learning engagement and activities to raise workforce capabilities in our meta-competency in learning agility Support Utilisation and Enhancement of Learning Technologies Generate insights on utilisation of learning technologies and support idea-generation and implementation to drive utilisation of learning technologies Support generation of reports and dashboards on learning technology platform to drive autonomous self-directed learning consumption You may also be tasked to participate in assignments that support HR, OCBC Campus or organisation-wide initiatives. Qualifications Key Competencies & Traits: Tech and data savviness - good with data visualisation and analytics tools (e.g. Tableau, PowerBI) with the ability to distil data into insights for decision making. Proficient in MS Office, in particular Excel and PowerPoint Has an eye for detail and is meticulous with presentation and representation of data Project management skills in planning and managing projects to meet desired outcomes; and ensure alignment of project to business objectives within agreed parameters of cost, schedule and scope covering development, implementation and/or maintenance Systems thinking - ability to connect the dots to develop a deeper appreciation of key issues and exercising good judgement to provide sound recommendations Ability to work effectively with stakeholders , possessing strong interpersonal and communication skills (written and verbal) to engage and influence stakeholders of all levels of seniority Has strong business acumen to understand business context and communicate in business language for organisation uptake Is an agile learner and thrives on fast-paced and dynamic work Likes autonomy to plan and self-direct work tasks Is naturally curious and a lifelong learner who would be open to give and take feedback Professional Experiences: A deep interest buttressed by strong technical and analytical skills to mine, draw insights, and visualise learning data in compelling ways that inform key executive decision-making Experience in learning analytics and visualisations would be an advantage Experience with cloud-based learning management systems, and specifically Cornerstone OnDemand would be an advantag Experience in organising outreach activities and campaigns

Title: Research Associate, - (Data Analyst & Machine Learning Specialist) - [R00008084]
Description: The Energy Research Institute NTU invites applications for the position of Research Associate. Key Responsibilities: Able to develop software codes for autonomous simultaneous localization and mapping of moving equipment. Should be able to develop framework for multi accesses edge computing. Train machine learning and deep learning models on a computing cluster to perform visual recognition tasks such as segmentation, detection, self-supervised depth estimation and end-to-end control. Multi sensor fusion based software integration from physical system to virtual environment. Prepare reports and documentations for the research programs, and support data analysis. Test and validate developed autonomous codes against physical systems. Program development for sensor systems and dashboard visualization. Creating lab scale setups and fixtures in tune to vehicle level performance. Formulating process experimental plans both lab level and real field level. Running experiments and troubleshooting systems. Developing potential improvements to the health monitoring system and testing potential solutions. Job Requirements: Master’s degree in computer science engineering/Electronics Engineering. Related degree preferred. Related experience would be given high priority. Experience with signal processing. Strong python programming, software development best practices, debugging and profiling. Knowledge on at least one mainstream deep learning framework such as Pytorch , Tensorflow and CNN. Familiarity with data science tool kit such as Jupyter, pandas, Linux environment. Familiarity of AWS or Azure. Solid understanding of algorithms, linear algebra, machine learning, computer systems/architecture, neural network. Basic Knowledge with sensor system, interface, data conversion and software programming. Effective communication and report writing skills. Experience in use of applicable business software applications. Prior experience and knowledge in Data analysis and Machine learning algorithms development. Interested applicants are invited to submit a cover letter and full CV in one document.We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Merchandise planner should work with the retailer to ensure restock shelves with new products based upon customer demand. They monitor sales, identify customer trends, predict customer demand, order merchandise, and analyze sales reports. Merchandise planners also bring in new products for customers’ anticipated needs and serve as liaisons between customers and marketing and procurement departments. They ensure that what the customer wants is available at the store. Buyers key duties & responsibilities: 1. Implement procurement strategy and policies. 2. Forecast procurement needs. 3. Responsible for planning, developing and buying merchandise in a timely and cost effective way; timely manner while maintaining appropriate quality standards and specifications.. 4. Help to lower the cost and secure agreements. 5. Monitor macro trends in supplier and contract base and implement plans to react. 6. Build and develop relationships with key suppliers and customers. 7. Order merchandise as per negotiated and appropriately approved. Review quotations, prepare purchase requisitions, approve and issues purchase orders in accordance with company policy and negotiated terms and conditions. 8. Maintain procurement files and records, produce when required by the management. 9. Liaise with the logistic team and arranging necessary document for shipment 10. Track Purchasing activity and measurements. 11. Discuss defective or unacceptable new goods or services with users, vendors and others to determine cause of problem and take corrective and preventative action. 12. Ensure supplier compliance with site and company requirements for safety. 13. Manage vendor relationships and assist in building effective partnerships. 14. Assist department in developing and implementing purchasing strategies for products. 15. Liaise with Accounts Payable Department to ensure accurate and timely payment of invoices, as necessary for the business with the supplier Retail Planner key duties & responsibilities: 1. Serve as a business partner to the buyers and others to analyze, plan, forecast, and evaluate financial data to support and implement profitable merchandise strategies. 2. Develop seasonal merchandise plans with team to maximize opportunities and minimize risk. 3. Forecast and validate projections to ensure sales, gross margin and inventory objectives are being met. 4. Manage inventory flow of goods to support sales and product turn for a portion of a product category as assigned. 5. Analyze and maintain individual store inventory levels to maximize sales and profits, while working closely with teammates to coordinate the flow of information in a timely manner to deliver product against deadline. 6. Collaborate with merchant and planning partners to develop yearly sales, margin and product turn plans and recommend divisional and departmental sales growth to drive business strategies. 7. Work with inventory team to ensure healthy balance of inventory. 8. Maintain in-season product plans and forecast. Collaborate with team to execute top-down and bottom-up roles of individual SKUs and styles. 9. Build a collaborative team relationship with merchant and supply chain Required skill for buyer and Merchandise Planner 1. In depth product knowledge and good communication. 2. Experience with enterprise resource planning, creative thinking, and deep learning. 3. Demonstrated skill at negotiation and collaboration. 4. Strict attention to detail and is a quick learner. 5. Can handle situations with an eye on continuous improvement and a positive attitude. 6. Demonstrated confidence and composure on the job. 7. Experience with remodels, sizing, and trends. 8. Advanced computer skills in Excel required (v-lookups, pivot tables, complex formulas) 9. Analyze sales and profits by square foot and by category. 10. Work with retailer team on a monthly basis to review selling at category/article/Style/Color/Size, and also on an impromptu basis when sales trends dictate changes to future forecasts. 11. Communicate with internal business partners (including design, sourcing, purchasing) major changes in business strategy and account needs 12. Basic knowledge of retail merchandise and presentation 13. Ability to travel. 14. Passionate about customer service (internal) 15. Driven to excel and succeed, taking full ownership of his or her success. 16. Problem Solving 17. Time Management 18. Strong interpersonal skills 19. Self-motivated 20. Persistent

Title: Data Analyst (Risk Control) - Global Payments
Description: Responsibilities Founded in 2012, ByteDance's mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. With a suite of more than a dozen products, including TikTok, Helo, and Resso, as well as platforms specific to the China market, including Toutiao, Douyin, and Xigua, ByteDance has made it easier and more fun for people to connect with, consume, and create content. Why Join Us At ByteDance, our people are humble, intelligent, compassionate and creative. We create to inspire - for you, for us, and for millions of users across all of our products. We lead with curiosity and aim for the highest, never shying away from taking calculated risks and embracing ambiguity as it comes. Here, the opportunities are limitless for those who dare to pursue bold ideas that exist just beyond the boundary of possibility. Join us and make impact happen with a career at ByteDance. The Global Payments team provides professional payment solutions with smooth functioning of payment channels to all global businesses of ByteDance to support the expansion and growth of ByteDance’s global businesses. Global payments has offices including: Beijing, Shanghai , Shenzhen, Hangzhou , Singapore and Mountain View. Global Payments Data Intelligence Risk Control team's works to minimise the frequency and damage of inauthentic behaviours in supporting international businesses (TikTok Live, TikTok Shop, Resso) with a data-driven approach. For example, this team is focused on optimising key payment metrics including but not limited to: fraud rate, chargeback rate, compliance rate, etc, through data intelligence approach to provide quality values to our customers. Our Global Payments Risk Control team mission is: To protect ByteDance users who are using Global Payments' service, including live stream creators and users, e-commerce buyers and sellers; To provide a safe payment experiences on our platforms by securing the integrity of our payments ecosystem, building infrastructures, platforms and technologies To collaborate with multiple cross-functional teams and stakeholders to provide exceptional values to our customers In this team, you'll be exposed to unique opportunities and experience first-hand exposure to company strategies in key security initiatives. Some examples are building scalable and robust, privacy-safe and intelligence, secure product and customer friendly systems and solutions. You'll be part of a team that's developing novel solutions to first-seen challenges in a fast paced environment of a phenomenal product eco-system. If you are looking for a fast paced environment and able to make real impact to businesses and customers, this role is for you. Responsibilities Identify, investigate, and communicate risks in the Global Payments ecosystem; Discover risk trends and behaviour patterns from big data sets; Conduct data analysis of risk cases and design long-term solutions; Provide insights to optimise risk strategies to create business values. Qualifications Bachelor's degree or above in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics or other related majors; 3 years and above of data analysis experience, preferably with domain experiences in Trust & Safety, Risk management, Anti Fraud; Proficient in big data tools such as SQL / Hive / Spark, etc; Data-sensitive, with strong data analysis and problem-solving skills, and strong data-driven sense; Ability to communicate and influence across teams and regions; ability to find win-win solutions that meet the objectives of cross-functional partners while reducing risk ByteDance is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At ByteDance, our mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

Title: Trading Data Analyst - World Trading
Description: Want to build a stronger, more sustainable future and cultivate your career? Join Cargill's global team of 155,000 employees who use new technologies, dynamic insights and over 154 years of experience to connect farmers with markets, customers with ingredients, and people and animals with the food they need to thrive. Job Purpose and Impact The Trading Data Analyst, will assist in the application of new models and globally integrated perspectives to generate strategic insights that will promote the company's competitive position and ultimately grow trading earnings. In this role, you will be a consumer of data working across product lines and assist in the evaluation of new data sets and new sources of data and participate in the design and implementation of basic application programming interfaces and data access queries by providing requirements for models or visualizations. Key Accountabilities Deploy a basic understanding of the trading questions that data can help to solve. Validate quality and coverage of datasets while helping to prioritize and implement well defined data and analytical tool development efforts based on trading opportunity. Collaborate across regional and global teams to ensure we capture, centralize and use the most valuable data for analysis in a systematic, repeatable and accurate manner with oversite from supervisor and higher level analysts. Partner with and support other data analysts to validate quality and coverage of datasets. Assist to define and design scalable and integrated data systems and processes and focus on continuous improvement of analytical methods and tools with oversite from supervisor and higher level team members. Handle basic issues and problems under direct supervision, while escalating more complex issues to appropriate staff. Other duties as assigned Qualifications MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS Bachelor’s degree in a related field or equivalent experience Knowledge of agricultural trading business and an understanding of the information that adds value to trading Ability to understand business requirements and serve as a consultant to internal teams Ability to develop queries using SQL and Python Experience with and understanding of relational and distributed data systems Experience using data visualization applications to develop and deploy insights and reporting Other minimum qualifications may apply PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS Familiarity with scientific programming languages Familiarity with using relational databases or distributed file storage applications Our Offer We provide a fast paced stimulating international environment, which will stretch your abilities and channel your talents. We also offer competitive salary and benefits combined with outstanding career development opportunities in one of the largest and most solid private companies in the world.

Description: Responsibilities Establish analytical framework for the TikTok Live streaming team: root cause analysis, core metrics monitoring, and automated dashboards to surface key data insights to stakeholders and inform product strategies. Evaluate and forecast the impact of product features on creators, agencies, operation and the TikTok ecosystem. Dive deep into the data to understand how creator, 3rd parties, and viewer behaviors change with the evolution of our product. Understand top performers and use data to explore and analyze actionable operational strategies. Act as our team's thought leader on best practices and move towards a long-term vision of sustainable and thriving data processes. Work hand-in-hand with operation, product, engineering, and design to proactively influence and inform teammates' decisions throughout the business lifecycle. Qualifications Bachelor degree or above, major in mathematics, statistics, computer science is preferred; or major in science or engineering or engaged in data statistics, analysis, modeling related working areas after graduation. 5+ years of domain experience in a mobile or consumer internet business, or in a high-velocity, high-growth product or team. Data analysis ability, familiar with Hive SQL, Python, R. Familiarity of machine learning Knowledge will be a plus. Familiar with statistics and dashboard, preferred to have experience in user growth, metrics creation, A/B testing, and data modeling. An impact-oriented, customer-centric approach to data analysis; Exceptional analysis, communication, and strategy report writing skills. Has a “can-do” attitude with a strong sense of ownership to execute end-to-end projects. Self-driven and able to manage and balance ongoing requests with proper prioritization.

Title: Research Associate / (Data Analyst & Machine Learning Specialist) [R00008084] #Immediate
Description: The Energy Research Institute NTU invites applications for the position of Research Associate. ﻿Key Responsibilities: Able to develop software codes for autonomous simultaneous localization and mapping of moving equipment. Should be able to develop framework for multi accesses edge computing. Train machine learning and deep learning models on a computing cluster to perform visual recognition tasks such as segmentation, detection, self-supervised depth estimation and end-to-end control. Multi sensor fusion based software integration from physical system to virtual environment. Prepare reports and documentations for the research programs, and support data analysis. Test and validate developed autonomous codes against physical systems. Program development for sensor systems and dashboard visualization. Creating lab scale setups and fixtures in tune to vehicle level performance. Formulating process experimental plans both lab level and real field level. Running experiments and troubleshooting systems. Developing potential improvements to the health monitoring system and testing potential solutions. Job Requirements: Master’s degree in computer science engineering/Electronics Engineering. Related degree preferred. Related experience would be given high priority. Experience with signal processing. Strong python programming, software development best practices, debugging and profiling. Knowledge on at least one mainstream deep learning framework such as Pytorch , Tensorflow and CNN. Familiarity with data science tool kit such as Jupyter, pandas, Linux environment. Familiarity of AWS or Azure. Solid understanding of algorithms, linear algebra, machine learning, computer systems/architecture, neural network. Basic Knowledge with sensor system, interface, data conversion and software programming. Effective communication and report writing skills. Experience in use of applicable business software applications. Prior experience and knowledge in Data analysis and Machine learning algorithms development. Interested applicants are invited to submit a cover letter and full CV in one document. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

We value user satisfaction and work on policies, rules, and systems to ensure quality for our community. As the Anti-fraud analyst, you will be responsible for building, improving, and monitoring business processes that detect and prevent fraudulent activities in various scenarios including transactions, KYC, and seller-creator affiliation. Apply investigational skills to monitor, audit, and analyze potential fraudulent cases and produce root cause analysis report with value-added risk mitigation suggestions; Collaborate with product managers, data scientists, and the engineering team to evaluate the efficiency of existing tools, processes, and policies related to fraud management; Understand the trends and intelligence of fraudulent activities in each local market and build intelligence systems to mitigate fraud; Define key performance metrics and build detailed reporting models for effective tracking, reporting, and feedback on measures implemented; Drive process implementation and improvement that streamlines determination of resellers, incentive abuse, and/or fake order evaluation; Communicate findings and complex results to key stakeholders and manage timeline of mitigation projects. Title: Data Analyst
Description: Responsibilities About TikTok TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo. Why Join Us At TikTok, our people are humble, intelligent, compassionate and creative. We create to inspire - for you, for us, and for more than 1 billion users on our platform. We lead with curiosity and aim for the highest, never shying away from taking calculated risks and embracing ambiguity as it comes. Here, the opportunities are limitless for those who dare to pursue bold ideas that exist just beyond the boundary of possibility. Join us and make impact happen with a career at TikTok. About the Team The DCC Data Science team within Monetization Integrity (MI) is seeking bright and endlessly curious data experts to help manage huge amounts of unstructured and structured data, in order to turn this content into business insights and also prepare it for machine learning. This group turns huge amounts of unstructured and structured data content into business insights and leverages machine learning to improve the customer experience and advertiser engagement. About the Role We expect you to have strong experience working with unstructured and structured data, to demonstrate clear communication, and to possess a strong desire to execute and best-in-class craftsmanship. You will spend part of your time on technical work and the other part collaborating cross-functionally with partners in product and engineering, to ensure TikTok scales in the most safe and compliant way. What You'll Need - Proficiency with databases and SQL expertise. Experience with large-scale data warehousing architecture and data modeling. Expertise with data processing (ETL) technologies is required. Experience in one programming language such as Java, Scala, or Python. Strong analytical skills. - Aptitude to independently learn new technologies. If need be, act as a leader to drive big efforts with other data analysts. What You'll Do Drive clarity and solve ambiguous, challenging business problems using data-driven approaches. Propose and own data analysis (including modeling, coding, analytics, and experimentation) to drive business insight and facilitate decisions. Dig into complex data sets and make sense out of them. Translate functional and technical requirements into architecture and design. Participate in code and design reviews to maintain high development standards. Measure business performance, develop core metrics and create dashboards to track and understand them. Identify data, metrics and analyses needs for business partners. Initiate, develop and maintain data pipelines and data models that power dashboards and data products with outstanding craftsmanship. Perform deep analyses and build models to understand customer behavior, and extract key insights that impact product decisions. Work across multiple subject matter specialists to drive new data initiatives, automation of reports, establish best practices and mentor junior members in the team. Lead analytics projects to completion. Work with the broader Data Science team to discover ways to scale our insights through better systems and automation. Qualifications Basic - PhD, MS or Bachelors degree in Statistics, Economics, Computer Science or another quantitative field. Knowledge of Hadoop related technologies such as HDFS. Experience building high-quality end-to-end data solutions in an agile environment from requirements to production. Be able to proactively handle prioritization of work and deliver work of great quality and to influence the broader team. Experience with Looker, Tableau, Power Bl, or other business intelligence platforms. Preferred Experience in technically mentoring junior team members. Previous experience working with social media data (unstructured and structured) is a plus. Strong communication skills, for example, demonstrated through documentation and presentations. Able to present findings to senior management to inform business decisions. Title: Research Assistant, - (Data Analyst), - #WorkNow #Immediate
Description: The Singapore Centre for Environmental Life Sciences Engineering (SCELSE) invites applications for the position of Research Assistant. The provision of safe drinking water is of upmost national importance. Engineered water systems (such as drinking water distribution and HVAC systems) contain consortia of microorganisms and extracellular polymeric substances referred to as biofilms. Biofilms have been shown to harbor a broad variety of microorganisms associated with corrosion of the pipe material, lead to the breakdown of residual disinfectants like monochloramine, and are known to support the growth of opportunistic waterborne pathogens. In previous projects, an array of sensor nodes was established wirelessly in the drinking water distribution networks (DWDS) of two campuses in Singapore, measuring water quality and leak-detection associated parameters in real-time, and providing easy access to the network. More recently, a simulated Intermittent Water Distribution system and laboratory scale HVAC / chiller unit circles have been established and will be the foundation of in-depth research into the impact of hydraulic and physicochemical conditions on the formation of potentially hazardous biofilms and their microbial composition. We are looking for a self-driven, committed, and inquisitive Data Analyst to join our drinking water distribution team at SCELSE. In addition to the in-depth analysis and visualization of data obtained from the various operational and simulated water systems, the candidate will develop and validate molecular assays (generating positive and negative controls, designing, and calculating standard curves, determining recovery rates and inhibition factors) and microfluidic-based methods to detect bacterial indicator organisms. The candidate will also be involved in laboratory and field operations such as biofilm and bulk water sampling as well as housekeeping tasks such as ongoing quality control for the methods used. A wide array of novel techniques will be used (e.g., whole genome and 16S rRNA metabarcoding sequencing and microfluidic flow cytometry) and the candidate will get insights into their application in a public health-related critical infrastructure. Key Responsibilities: Planning, organizing, and conducting outdoor sampling of three well-established DWDS testbeds to understand the impact of operational events on drinking water quality. Analyzing water quality parameters Application of a wide array of novel molecular techniques and methods (e.g., next generation sequencing and high-sensitivity flow cytometry) for the analysis of samples collected in DWDS Validation and maintenance of quality control for current workflow based on advanced bioinformatical approaches Application of a wide variety of data analysis tools (e.g., R, Python and Graphpad) to gain insights into microbial communities in water and their relationships with physicochemical water quality parameters Interpretation and visualization of complex data sets Job Requirements: BSc in environmental engineering, data analysis or related disciplines. Advanced knowledge in collecting data, data processing and laboratory techniques. Basic understanding of biofilm biology, its relevance and detection methods. Experience in setting up and maintaining remote sensing equipment as well as experimental testbeds. An analytical mind and inclination for problem-solving. Experience in flow cytometry. Experience in analyzing large datasets using R, working independently, and data modeling We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Title: Equity Data Specialist (Vietnamese Speaker) Early Professional Program - Singapore
Description: Bloomberg runs on data, and data drives the market. Our Data team acquires and supplies this data to our clients. Teams work collaboratively to collect, analyze, process and publish the data which is the backbone of our iconic Bloomberg Terminal - the data ultimately feeding and moving the financial markets. The Team: The global Companies Data team provides market-leading data with industry insights across a wide array of datasets that cover Company Financial information including the description of business activities, industry classification, equity fundamentals, broker estimates, ESG, supply chain, corporate events, company management and more. We partner closely with the Product, Engineering, Sales and News areas to create derived data products to support the numerous use cases that our clients heavily rely on to drive their workflows. The Role: As an Equities Data Analyst in Companies Data team, you will manage company financial data that feeds into the Bloomberg products. You will use your data management & problem-solving skills to maintain the workflow of extracting, transforming and loading of timely, accurate and comprehensive data across various Bloomberg platforms. You will identify innovative workflow efficiencies, implement technical solutions to enhance our systems, products and processes. You will be instrumental in building and maintaining relationships with key players in the financial market. Our Equity Data Analysts possess a unique combination of business & financial market aptitude, strong communication skills and ability to build relationships with various stakeholders, as well as interest in technology (or data management related tools). You will play a key role in empowering our clients to make well-informed business decisions. Providing exceptional support assisting our clients with their data queries is a key part of the role. We’ll trust you to: Acquire, update, and maintain high-quality financial data using internal systems and proprietary company software Provide timely and in-depth customer support for users of the Bloomberg Terminal and our associated Enterprise Products Monitor financial market developments to build industry knowledge and data analytical capabilities that generate premium content, including data-driven news stories Lead ad hoc projects to optimize processes and/or improve the quality of the data set Use statistics and data visualization skills to report on results of on-going operations and projects, as required Contribute to continuous improvement by generating ideas to improve our data products and/or associated processes and building prototypes to validate and illustrate requirements Partner with a wide variety of teams ranging from Engineering to Sales on product development This is an entry level role where you’ll need to have: Up to 2 years of work experience Demonstrated experience interpreting Financial Statements, and understanding of Financial Analysis and Accounting Principles and Procedures A demonstrated capability in Data Management, Data Cleaning & Processing, or Data Analysis Experience in customer service or client relationship management within the Audit or financial industry A demonstrated interest or aspiration to work in the financial market Effective project management skills and ability to prioritize tasks accordingly Ability to communicate effectively and articulate thought process clearly Excellent written and verbal communication skills, especially when explaining technical processes and solutions to clients, business partners, and stakeholders Business proficiency and fluency in?English & Vietnamese to manage respective clients and financial data We’d love to see: Bachelor’s Degree in combined studies in Finance, Accounting, Business Analytics, or a related degree Demonstrated project or work experience using one more programming language such as Python, SQL and R Previous work experience using the Bloomberg Terminal or Bloomberg Market Concepts (BMC) certification Does this sound like you? Title: Research Assistant, - [Data Analyst] - #WorkNow #Urgent |- #JobsThatMatter
Description: The Singapore Centre for Environmental Life Sciences Engineering (SCELSE) invites applications for the position of Research Assistant. The provision of safe drinking water is of upmost national importance. Engineered water systems (such as drinking water distribution and HVAC systems) contain consortia of microorganisms and extracellular polymeric substances referred to as biofilms. Biofilms have been shown to harbor a broad variety of microorganisms associated with corrosion of the pipe material, lead to the breakdown of residual disinfectants like monochloramine, and are known to support the growth of opportunistic waterborne pathogens. In previous projects, an array of sensor nodes was established wirelessly in the drinking water distribution networks (DWDS) of two campuses in Singapore, measuring water quality and leak-detection associated parameters in real-time, and providing easy access to the network. More recently, a simulated Intermittent Water Distribution system and laboratory scale HVAC / chiller unit circles have been established and will be the foundation of in-depth research into the impact of hydraulic and physicochemical conditions on the formation of potentially hazardous biofilms and their microbial composition. We are looking for a self-driven, committed, and inquisitive Data Analyst to join our drinking water distribution team at SCELSE. In addition to the in-depth analysis and visualization of data obtained from the various operational and simulated water systems, the candidate will develop and validate molecular assays (generating positive and negative controls, designing, and calculating standard curves, determining recovery rates and inhibition factors) and microfluidic-based methods to detect bacterial indicator organisms. The candidate will also be involved in laboratory and field operations such as biofilm and bulk water sampling as well as housekeeping tasks such as ongoing quality control for the methods used. A wide array of novel techniques will be used (e.g., whole genome and 16S rRNA metabarcoding sequencing and microfluidic flow cytometry) and the candidate will get insights into their application in a public health-related critical infrastructure. Key Responsibilities: Planning, organizing, and conducting outdoor sampling of three well-established DWDS testbeds to understand the impact of operational events on drinking water quality. Analyzing water quality parameters Application of a wide array of novel molecular techniques and methods (e.g., next generation sequencing and high-sensitivity flow cytometry) for the analysis of samples collected in DWDS Validation and maintenance of quality control for current workflow based on advanced bioinformatical approaches Application of a wide variety of data analysis tools (e.g., R, Python and Graphpad) to gain insights into microbial communities in water and their relationships with physicochemical water quality parameters Interpretation and visualization of complex data sets Job Requirements: BSc in environmental engineering, data analysis or related disciplines. Advanced knowledge in collecting data, data processing and laboratory techniques. Basic understanding of biofilm biology, its relevance and detection methods. Experience in setting up and maintaining remote sensing equipment as well as experimental testbeds. An analytical mind and inclination for problem-solving. Experience in flow cytometry. Experience in analyzing large datasets using R, working independently, and data modeling We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Title: E-commerce Data Analyst

With millions of loyal users globally, we believe TikTok is an ideal platform to deliver a brand new and better e-commerce experience to our users. Overall responsible for data support of e-commerce overseas operation module; Daily output and follow up the data output of the whole operation and each module; Operation core index design, data dashboard design landing, core index data abnormal monitoring; Data analysis and follow-up of operation activities in overseas countries; In depth analysis of business, user, commodity and other data, and provide to the operation team to support the operation strategy; Follow up the local operation work overseas, support the operation effect and give the follow-up optimization suggestions; Cooperate with product / operation / R & D, promote the implementation of optimization scheme, and bring about the actual improvement and growth of business; Responsible for all kinds of a / b experiment design and analysis; Analysis of the overall overseas market and business operation of a certain country. Qualifications Bachelor degree or above, major in mathematics, statistics, computer is preferred; or major in science or engineering or engaged in data statistics, analysis, modeling related working areas after graduation； Proficient in SQL, can use Python or R for data analysis； At least 3 years of working Experience in e-commerce business and analysis is preferred； Overseas business experience or analytical experience is preferred； Able to write requirement documents in English and communicate with global staff; Have a strong learning ability and curiosity;ability to pick up domain knowledge in new areas quickly; Can lead a small project team to support business; Have a strong ability to work under pressure, have the courage to overcome difficulties and accept challenges.

Title: Senior Livestream Business Data Analyst
Description: Responsibilities About TikTok TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo. Why Join Us At TikTok, our people are humble, intelligent, compassionate and creative. We create to inspire - for you, for us, and for more than 1 billion users on our platform. We lead with curiosity and aim for the highest, never shying away from taking calculated risks and embracing ambiguity as it comes. Here, the opportunities are limitless for those who dare to pursue bold ideas that exist just beyond the boundary of possibility. Join us and make impact happen with a career at TikTok. About the team Livestream Team is committed to creating real-time interactive scenes, As a new form of content, livestream creates value for all parties in the ecology. Livestream provides users with a unique consumption experience and further generalizes content. It is also a new way of employment to provide more direct fan interaction and deepen relationships with authors; It provides healthy and objective revenue to the platform and promotes content exclusivity. It also serves as a "new infrastructure" for the expansion of ecological boundaries. Responsibilities Establish analytical framework for the TikTok Live streaming team: root cause analysis, core metrics monitoring, and automated dashboards to surface key data insights to stakeholders and inform product strategies. Evaluate and forecast the impact of product features on creators, agencies, operation and the TikTok ecosystem. Dive deep into the data to understand how creator, 3rd parties, and viewer behaviors change with the evolution of our product. Understand top performers and use data to explore and analyze actionable operational strategies. Act as our team's thought leader on best practices and move towards a long-term vision of sustainable and thriving data processes. Work hand-in-hand with operation, product, engineering, and design to proactively influence and inform teammates' decisions throughout the business lifecycle. Qualifications Bachelor degree or above, major in mathematics, statistics, computer science is preferred; or major in science or engineering or engaged in data statistics, analysis, modeling related working areas after graduation. 5+ years of domain experience in a mobile or consumer internet business, or in a high-velocity, high-growth product or team. Data analysis ability, familiar with Hive SQL, Python, R. Familiarity of machine learning Knowledge will be a plus. Familiar with statistics and dashboard, preferred to have experience in user growth, metrics creation, A/B testing, and data modeling. An impact-oriented, customer-centric approach to data analysis; Exceptional analysis, communication, and strategy report writing skills. Has a “can-do” attitude with a strong sense of ownership to execute end-to-end projects. Self-driven and able to manage and balance ongoing requests with proper prioritization. TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

Title: VP, Private Wealth Data Analyst, Consumer Banking Group - (210000BT) #JobsThatMatter
Description: Consumer Banking Group As the leading bank in Asia, DBS Consumer Banking Group is in a unique position to help our customers realise their dreams and ambitions. As a market leader in the consumer banking business, DBS has a full spectrum of products and services, including deposits, investments, insurance, mortgages, credit cards and personal loans, to help our customers realise their dreams and aspirations at every life stage. The data function sits within the business and is a key enabler of transformative change to deliver incremental value and outcomes for the Consumer Banking and Wealth Management Group. Prior experience or exposure to private bank or wealth management domain. Proficient in SQL/Python/SAS programming, MS Excel and be comfortable with processing large volume of data. Experience in delivering complex initiatives and to engage with cross functional stakeholders. Self-starter, good communication and presentation skill.

Title: Business Analyst
Description: Reporting to Head of Trade Marketing, you will drive insights and reports for all teams to help us track, measure and optimize our performance. The Analyst will have deep analytical skills and will be comfortable working with stakeholders to create meaningful stories from the data. This person will be organizing data to build appropriate visualizations with actionable insights to business stakeholders. As a Business Analyst, he/she will have the opportunity to work closely with the business partners plus growth, supply and tech teams to solve sophisticated and high impact problems using Excel, Power BI. The ideal candidate is a self-starter, and a creative, critical thinker. You must be a strong communicator and be able to work independently to generate high-quality work. Roles & Responsibilities Gather information on key business components pertaining to technology and processes that impact business performance (e.g. sales) and data fragmentation. Acquiring, cleansing and combining various and disparate data sets from different sources. Making meaningful correlations and logical insights from data trends. Engage multiple internal touch points, particularly Trade Marketing Finance and Supply Services to give desired visibility of the Singapore business. Liaison with Finance for P&L related processes such as spend forecasting, accruals, claims etc. Cross team collaboration with team members and business stakeholders to understand their business problems and answer those problems with data. Create analysis and data models proactively, using available data to identify meaningful relationships, patterns, anomalies and trends. Develop and automate reports, iteratively build and prototype dashboards that can communicate the right KPIs to business and provide insights at scale. Strong budget monitoring ensuring that key media spends are captured & aligned with targets and any over/under spends are anticipated. Communicate complex ideas based on data analysis in clear and concise manner. Requirements Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Information Systems, Statistics, Business or Computer Science Excellent data analysis skills, with the ability to pull from many different data sources and provide insights on that data. Minimum 2+ years of analytics experience working with a data analyst. Minimum 2+ years of experience with BI tools like Tableau, Data Studio, Power BI, etc. Minimum 2+ years of experience in FMCG environment. Ability to analyse data and build models in Excel is required.
