Title: VP/AVP, Private Wealth Data Analyst (MarTech Data Science), Consumer Banking Group - (WD46262) #JobsThatMatter
Description: About Us This is Team Awesome. We support DBS Private Bank who aims to be the World’s Best Private Bank. Its purpose is to serve the wealth management needs of ultra-high net worth (HNW) individuals and their families across the globe from Singapore to China to Dubai, and the UK. We pride ourselves on being a globally minded purpose-driven Private Bank that understands their needs for today and tomorrow, offering family office services and advancing the sustainability agenda. We, the MarTech team, work closely with the business to turn our ambition into reality by 2025. We are transforming ourselves to be one of the best teams in Asia, to create high-quality marketing with impact and talk value. We bring our best selves to work, thriving in a safe environment of learning, discovering, and relearning. We are each other’s champions and supporters, performing at the standards we set for ourselves, and having a fulfilling time together. We strive to create a positive and enjoyable culture as well as a family-like environment for our team. What you will do Know our clients well . Uncover client insights using Machine Learning and research to enhance client journeys, spark client conversations, and identify acquisition opportunities. Embrace data . Tap into teammates and the rich technology systems DBS has invested in to understand clients. Shaping and delivering exceptional client experiences to drive engagement, retention, and revenue growth. Ask why not . We are boosting our current wealth management business from our current level to the best in the world. This is going to involve creativity, problem-solving, and finding ways to get things done together. Drive performance . Use Machine Learning and AI to create recommendation solutions that optimise experiences throughout the client journey. Test, Learn, and Repeat Help design measurement frameworks and optimisation strategies to create better client experience and improve marketing performance. Work on an international stage Cross-border (HK, CN, Taiwan, SEA, London, and Dubai) and cross-functional collaboration with key stakeholders across wealth planning, CIO, investment products, business management, data, design, etc. to enable smooth execution of strategic initiatives. Know the market . Work with research partners, internal stakeholders, and industry experts to understand as well as identify wealth and HNW industry and trends; make appropriate recommendations proactively About you Experience . Seasoned professional with minimum of 4-8 years developing advanced analytics solutions in the banking/wealth or HNW space. Python programming experience is a plus. Credentialed. Ph.D./Master’s Degree in Banking/Finance, Business, Mathematics/Statistics, Computer or related disciplines. Self-starter . Effective self-starter who flourishes in a fast-paced, results-driven environment. Collaborative . Adaptable and respectful of different work cultures across regional markets. Mentally agile . Ability to connect the dots between strategy and execution with strong analytical skills and data-driven thinking. Creative enabler . Ability to use data storytelling to open minds and suggest inventive solutions And more …… Good understanding of the data science production life cycle with demonstrable experience working with structured, semi-structured, and unstructured data Excellent software skills ( Python, SQL, bash ) and knowledge in design patterns and code optimisation Good grasp of Machine Learning models and concepts, their mathematical underpinnings, and trade-offs (model selection, tuning, problem formulation, drift, semi-supervised learning) Experience using NLP techniques (NER, Sentiment Analysis, Topic Modelling, transformers) Experience using Machine Learning frameworks (TensorFlow, Pytorch, Spark, Hydra) We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description: Responsibilities: leading the implementation of Student Data Governance (SDG) framework across Student Admin Departments, Colleges, and Schools; Secretariat support to the SDG Steering Committee Meetings leading and conducting Data Quality (DQ) Assurance programme across different data areas and monitor DQ via developing DQ dashboard developing and managing student data catalogue for management reporting and data analytics projects driving the adoption of NTU Education Dashboards to support decision-making at different level of the University leading, developing, and managing data analytics projects to provide enhanced insights from student data, such as student profiling, data analysis to support policy maker in relevant policies, predictive analysis of students at-risk, degree programme quality assurance analysis, student quantitative or qualitative feedback analysis using Natural Language Processing (NLP) training staff in data-related framework, concepts, and competency in data analytics supporting business data users in student data migration activities (including profiling, cleansing, mapping of data) during the Student Management System (SMS) project implementation [The role is expected to lead and facilitate, in addition to execution.] Requirements: Bachelor / Master’s degree in data sciences / computer science / mathematics More than 5 years’ working experiences in data analytics / data governance Possesses technical expertise in data models, database design & development, data mining & machine learning; knowledge in Natural Language Processing (NLP) is an advantage Good knowledge of and experience with data visualisation tools (e.g., Qlik Sense), and programming languages including Python/R and SQL Experience in planning and developing data analytic projects to support business needs Ability to communicate effectively with business users on data-related requirements and outcomes

Title: CIB Operations - Securities Services - Reference Data Operations - Associate - Singapore #Seekbetter#WorkNow | #Seekbetter
Description: Job Description Asset Reference Data Services (ARDS) ARDS was created with the mission to help improve the quality, integrity, and reliability of the firm's critical data covering the Instrument and Pricing domains and sits within Securities Services. The organization's objectives are to deliver business impact through fit-for-purpose data, improve data capabilities across multiple lines of businesses (LOBs), implement data controls, and deliver reference data. ARDS establishes expectations that drive consistent data governance practices, develops technologies and processes to support data governance capabilities, partners with LOBs to embed data governance best practices and capabilities, and ensures sustainability by refining, measuring, and improving the ability to manage data. Within ARDS, the Instrument Reference Data Operations teams provide high quality Reference Data to its subscribers from major external market providers under a single operating model. Asset prices and instrument attributes are sourced, validated, mastered and distributed via J.P. Morgan’s strategic Reference Data architecture and is used for trading, risk management, fund valuation, settlement and regulatory reporting. Role Description We are seeking a seasoned Data Analyst in operations at the Associate level. The role is based in Singapore and will provide operational support and data management for our Securities Services, Markets and AWM businesses. The role will manage data quality and exceptions for reference data operations, working with a team of data analyst. The role will work closely with professionals across Instrument and Pricing. The individual will ensure a robust control framework and effective global operating model are being used to service the APAC businesses. The successful candidate should be able to provide strategic initiatives on improving reference data operations. This role covers the early shift (6am start), the candidate must be able to work this shift. Key Responsibilities: Responsible for following the global operating model is effectively servicing the instrument and pricing requirements for the APAC businesses strongly focused on Securities Services and Markets business at JPM Leverage data tools, languages, platforms, dashboards and technology to advance JPM data strategy Work with the team responsible for the creation/maintenance and management of exceptions of instrument reference data on our core platforms Provide subject matter expertise support to downstream teams and clients Ensure proper controls are in place to reduce financial risks, implement procedures to enforce controls and ensure controls are adhered to Resolve client queries promptly and professionally Contribute to ongoing developments of the instrument control process As the team covers the APAC region, staggered shift work and working on public holidays is required Ad-hoc project work when required Qualifications: Applicants must have a Bachelor’s degree (in Finance, Science or Technology) or equivalent At least 3+ years work experience in Financial Services is required Experience in Banking Operations or Middle Office is an advantage Experience leading or managing teams/people preferred Strong market data vendor knowledge/experience, i.e. Bloomberg, Refinitiv is required Knowledge of industry activities, corporate actions, index tracking and capital markets is required Strong understanding of broad financial instruments and products required Self-motivated and proactive with the proven ability to work accurately and under pressure to meet deadlines Strong analytical/problem solving skills and attention to detail Demonstrate ability to effectively communicate within a team environment and interact across departments Demonstrate customer focus and follow-up skills Ability to work independently and multi-task in a fast paced environment Ability to analyze, mine and query data to formulate solutions and efficiencies Good understanding of databases, data models and data structures

Title: IT Data Analyst | #UrgentHire#
Description: Your role Are you interested in developing regulatory reporting solutions using the latest technologies? Are you confident at iteratively refining user requirements and removing any ambiguity? Do you like to be challenged and encouraged to learn and grow professionally? We are looking for IT Data Analyst to: Design, plan and deliver sustainable solutions using modern programming languages (Apache Spark 2.x, Databricks, SCALA) Provide technical expertise and recommendations in assessing new software projects and initiatives to support and enhance our existing applications Work with key stakeholders including business change teams and wider SMEs within CTB organizations in GCRG technology to identify and delivery on functional/System design, Data model / Data Quality Performance tuning improvement opportunities Use technical knowhow (Enterprise Architecture, Database, data model) to support Capability Change teams to design data models and ensure logical and physical data models are properly reflected in data model repository of GCRG (Enterprise architecture, DGP) Your team You’ll be working in the Group Compliance, Regulatory & Governance IT team based in Pune. Our role is to design and implement IT solutions for global Regulatory Reporting requirements (Major shareholding disclosures, Short Selling disclosures, 13F reporting, Conflict clearance, etc). We are a global IT team supporting internal clients throughout the world. Your expertise System Analyst / Big Data Engineer / Data Analyst focused on developing regulatory reporting solutions Strong experience with data warehousing, SQL, PL/SQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle databases Experience with Big Data technologies like Spark 2.0, SPARK SQL, Databricks using Scala or Python Well versed with working on Azure cloud platform. Good understanding of financial products and front to back trade lifecycle Experienced handling critical L3 support queries Design, plan and deliver solutions in a large-scale enterprise environment About us UBS is the world’s largest and only truly global wealth manager. We operate through four business divisions: Global Wealth Management, Personal & Corporate Banking, Asset Management and the Investment Bank. Our global reach and the breadth of our expertise set us apart from our competitors. With more than 70,000 employees, we have a presence in all major financial centers in more than 50 countries. Do you want to be one of us? Join us From gaining new experiences in different roles to acquiring fresh knowledge and skills, at UBS we know that great work is never done alone. We know that it's our people, with their unique backgrounds, skills, experience levels and interests, who drive our ongoing success. Together we’re more than ourselves. Ready to be part of #teamUBS and make an impact? Disclaimer / Policy Statements UBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce. Employees working from UBS Singapore offices must comply with Workforce Vaccination Measures as implemented by the Singapore government with effect from 1 January 2022, and other applicable safe management measures as may be amended from time to time.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description: Job Duties: - Analyze financial data, and identify relevant insights considering the company's goals and financial standing. - Monitor current & past financial performance, identify trends or abnormal fluctuations, and deep dive into major problems. - Coordinate with internal and external teams as needed. - Participate in the implementation, advancement, and monitoring of the risk control platform, credit risk modeling, and anti-fraud rules. - Explore datasets, extract features and develop customized models and algorithms (i.e. GBDT, XGBOOST, Neural Network, etc.). Requirement: - Bachelor’s Degree or higher in a quantitative major (computer science, mathematics, physics, statistics, etc.) - 1+ years of experience in consumer finance. - Good numerical reasoning skills & data analysis skills. - Exposure to one or more data analysis packages or databases, e.g: SAS, R, SPSS, MYSQL, Oracle, MongoDB, hive - Hands-on experience using at least one of the following programming languages:Python.

Title: Senior Data Analyst (Banking|Up to $8.5k)
Description: This is an exciting opportunity to work for one of the leading banks in Singapore. The Opportunity This is an exciting opportunity to work for one of the leading banks in Singapore It is an opportunity for an experienced Senior Data Analyst to join their team Office Location: CBD The Job Be a key member of the data analysis team breaking down data problems into smaller parts that can be resolved in a targeted way Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets Work with a team of analysts, comprising of businesses, business analysts, process subject matter experts, technology leads to deliver current state analysis, process re-engineering, establish and facilitate resolution to data quality issues Leverage technical capabilities to drive the development, evolution, and implementation of data enhancements, that will enable self-service by data consumers Evaluate data management, data quality and data access processes for gaps, inefficiencies, and opportunities; provide recommendations for improvement Implement solutions and processes for management and governance across data quality metrics, metadata, lineage, data access rights and business definitions Establish effective and adaptable stakeholder working group Provide support to users and assist business unit controllers in translating data requirements into deliverables Ensure technical solutions provided are appropriate and support process changes Ensure successful delivery of resolutions and enhancements from analysis and specification of users' requirements, solutioning, test planning, facilitation of simulation, preparation for implementation, live verification, and documentation Maintain a robust communication between all the stakeholders to ensure coordination and delivery of task and activities, proper engagement and drive effective management decision making on relevant issues escalation The Talent 3-5 years of experience with exposure to Financial Services, Consulting, Fintech/Technology with minimum 1-2 years of data analytics experience. Experience analyzing large datasets; applying mathematical, statistical and quantitative analysis techniques to perform complex analyses and data mining R / Python / Data Analytics Certification is an added advantage Experience in using Big Data platforms and software, e.g. R, Python, Hive, Pig etc. is desirable Demonstrated passion for numbers, strategic planning skills, financial products / emerging big data technology and how they will impact the consumer experience Team player and highly collaborative Strong oral & written communication Next Steps Drop your resume and contact us to follow-up, or send your resume to cecilia.sim@adecco.com Email Topic: Apply Senior Data Analyst Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted Cecilia Sim Xin Yang EA License No: 91C2918 Personnel Registration Number: R22105099

Title: CIB Operations - Securities Services, - Reference Data Operations - Analyst - Singapore #JobsThatMatter #Immediate #UrgentHire#Urgent
Description: Job Description ARDS was created with the mission to help improve the quality, integrity, and reliability of the firm's critical data covering the Instrument and Pricing domains and sits within Securities Services. The organization's objectives are to deliver business impact through fit-for-purpose data, improve data capabilities across multiple lines of businesses (LOBs), implement data controls, and deliver reference data. ARDS establishes expectations that drive consistent data governance practices, develops technologies and processes to support data governance capabilities, partners with LOBs to embed data governance best practices and capabilities, and ensures sustainability by refining, measuring, and improving the ability to manage data. Within ARDS, the Instrument Reference Data Operations teams provide high quality Reference Data to its subscribers from major external market providers under a single operating model. Asset prices and instrument attributes are sourced, validated, mastered and distributed via J.P. Morgan’s strategic Reference Data architecture and is used for trading, risk management, fund valuation, settlement and regulatory reporting. Role Description We are seeking a Data Analyst in operations at the Analyst level. The role is based in Singapore and will provide operational support and data management for our Securities Services, Markets and AWM businesses. The role will manage data quality and exceptions for reference data operations, working with a team of data analyst. The role will work closely with professionals across Instrument and Pricing. The individual will ensure a robust control framework and effective global operating model are being used to service the APAC businesses. The successful candidate should be able to provide strategic initiatives on improving reference data operations. Key Responsibilities: Responsible for following the global operating model is effectively servicing the instrument and pricing requirements for the APAC businesses strongly focused on Securities Services and Markets business at JPM Work with the team responsible for the creation/maintenance and management of exceptions of instrument reference data on our core platforms Provide subject matter expertise support to downstream teams and clients Ensure proper controls are in place to reduce financial risks, implement procedures to enforce controls and ensure controls are adhered to Resolve client queries promptly and professionally Contribute to ongoing developments of the instrument control process As the team covers the APAC region, staggered shift work and working on public holidays is required Ad-hoc project work when required Qualifications: Applicants must have a Bachelor’s degree (in Finance, Science or Technology) or equivalent Open to Newbies with prior internship experience in Financial Services One year of work experience in Financial Services will be an advantage Strong market data vendor knowledge/experience, i.e. Bloomberg, Definitive is preferred Knowledge of industry activities, corporate actions, index tracking and capital markets is preferred Good understanding of broad financial instruments and products required Self-motivated and proactive with the proven ability to work accurately and under pressure to meet deadlines Good analytical/problem solving skills and attention to detail Demonstrate ability to effectively communicate within a team environment and interact across departments Demonstrate customer focus and follow-up skills Ability to work independently and multi-task in a fast paced environment Ability to analyze, mine and query data to formulate solutions and efficiencies is preferred Good understanding of databases, data models and data structures is preferred Working knowledge of dashboard tools (Power BI, Tableau, Qlik) preferred

Title: Product Data Analyst - Data Analysis
Description: Responsibilities [About Tiktok] TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo. [About the Team] The Product Data Analytics Team analyzes a combination of product usage and product performance data to derive meaningful insights that would serve as a guide to better product and decision making for our business leaders. Responsibilities Perform analysis on product usage product performance data. Identify factors affecting product usage, performance and growth, derive meaningful insights to guide to better product and decision making for our business leaders. Work with cross functional partners (Product Managers/Operations/Engineering etc.) for product optimization and bring value to the business. Design A/B experiments to optimize and drive future product developments. Perform market activity analysis and any other analytics that would help guide product and business decision making. Construct specialized data models based on product needs and business requirements. Able to operate with minimal supervision and independently identify + support data analysis needs of product and business lines. Coach and mentor junior members of the team. Setting clear team goals and overseeing day to day team operation. Qualifications [Minimum Qualifications] Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Mathematics or any other relevant fields. 2+ years of proven work experience in Analytics of any Internet or large scale B2C products. Excellent communication skills with ability to communicate conclusions effectively to both technical and non-technical audiences. Ability to partner effectively with product and business leaders. Using data to influence stakeholders in a matrixed organization. Proficiency in Tableau, or similar data visualization tools. Proficiency in SQL, Python. Strong user affinity with solid understanding of product usage and performance.

Title: Data Analyst
Description: Roles & Responsibilities You will be based in our integrated lubricants and grease production facility in Tuas, Singapore, and will be partnering with business stakeholders to build a truly integrated, collaborative, and competitive supply chain for Lubricants. What is the role: As the Digital and Data Analyst, your key accountabilities include the following: Perform reviews of digitalisation project initiatives to ensure timely completion and value delivery. Liaise with government agencies to understand their steer in Industry 4.0 and highlight fit-for-purpose suggestions to activities. Extract data from data platforms, track and report Key Performance Index (KPI). KPI may include but are not limited to: Overall Equipment Efficiency (OEE), Energy Performance Index and CO2 footprint, Blend Right First Time (RFT), Sample Track and Trace (STT), Days in Inventory (DIO) etc. Perform detailed data analysis on the KPIs and set target on those KPIs. Perform data-based evaluation to identify work processes that is less than efficient and suggest areas of improvement. Perform weekly discussions and cadence with production, planning, logistics and quality team to plan and execute improvement items. Work with internal and external stakeholders to design, execute and implement new digital tools. What we need from you: To succeed in this role, you will have: Bachelor’s degree in Engineering discipline or equivalent. Minimum 3-5 years of relevant work experience. Awareness in Industry 4.0 and Skilled in Data analytical/ visualisation tools (Spotfire/ Phyton/ Power Bi etc). Experience in LEAN and/or Continuous Improvement (CI) methodologies is a plus. Demonstrated interest and outward focus on new technologies, sustainability, industry trends. Experience with manufacturing and production operations. Excellent communication skills across organisation levels. Strong teamwork & collaboration skills. Basic proficiency in MS Office.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description: Getting onboard Razer will place you on a global mission to revolutionize the way the world games. Razer is a place to do great work , offering you the opportunity to make an impact globally while working across a global team located across 5 continents. Razer is also a great place to work, providing you the unique, gamer-centric #LifeAtRazer experience that will put you in an accelerated growth, both personally and professionally. Job Responsibilities Ability to organize and present business statistics into easily understandable documents that can cater to different levels of an organization Engage with business teams to understand requirements and build operational and sales reports Translate reporting requirements to technical teams in order to extract and organise data to build aforementioned reports Plan and execute tests to ensure data obtained from systems are accurate and reliable Work with relevant teams to determine structure and content of data pipeline for current and future business requirements Work with relevant teams to achieve continuous improvement and updating of data pipeline Pay meticulous attention to detail and have the ability to multitask and prioritise tasks with a strong sense of urgency Ad-hoc report or chart generation based on Management’s request Pre-Requisites Minimally 5 years of industry experience in business analytics, marketing analytics or a similar quantitative discipline Recent experience of using advanced analytics and some combination of Coding skills, Analytics tools experience (e.g. R, SQL), data visualization (e.g. Tableau, Excel, Power BI, etc) or have experience performing analysis with large datasets Familiarity with SAP products is a plus Strong relationship management and interpersonal skills, to be able to articulate findings and analysis to a diverse audience

Title: Business & Data Analyst
Description: What do we do ? Join the ride at SWAT Mobility - If you're up for a challenge with one of the most exciting startups in the field of Smart Mobility, Transit and Logistics Technology! SWAT is a high-tech mobility company that focuses on dynamic, on-demand, ride-sharing technology. With our world-class routing platform, we have deployed our solutions for governments in Singapore, Japan and Australia. Having deployed in 8 countries, we also look at solving multiple mobility challenges including optimizing employee transport for large corporations, reimagining public transport, creating data driven intelligent transport planning and introducing high tech logistics solutions to bring higher convenience, better visibility and reduced cost to our customers. We are on a mission to empower the world to move more with less. SWAT is looking for a Business & Data Analyst to join the Analytics Team. The ideal candidate is someone who is able to think critically, is a self-starter, and comfortable with open ended problem solving. We value effective communicators with a positive work attitude that are motivated by the desire to learn, achieve and contribute. Responsibilities Partner with sales and operations teams in developing pre-sales solutions, analyzing client data and validating solutions with our in-house simulation engine. Support analytics services delivering large-scale analytics consulting projects. Design and implement operational dashboards and queries for internal/external stakeholders to assist in pattern, trend and business insights identification. Write scripts to automate reports workflows and processing of large datasets. Desired Skills Advanced Python knowledge Basic to intermediate SQL knowledge Ability to work with large amounts of data to discover patterns and trends and form conclusions based on findings. Must be extremely detail oriented. Ability to create beautiful, structured presentation decks Excellent analytical, communication and problem-solving skills Exposure to one or more dashboarding platforms (Tableau/PowerBI/Metabase) Knowledge of Geographical Information Systems (GIS) tools would be a bonus Experience in the transportation sector would be a bonus Qualifications Minimum of 2 years experience in a Data Analytics role. Bachelor’s Degree or higher from a recognised university, preferably in a quantitative subject. If you are not from a quantitative subject you are still more than welcome to apply, so long as you are able to meet the technical skill requirements specified above.

Title: IT Data Analyst | #Immediate #Urgent#
Description: Your role Are you interested in developing regulatory reporting solutions using the latest technologies? Are you confident at iteratively refining user requirements and removing any ambiguity? Do you like to be challenged and encouraged to learn and grow professionally? We are looking for IT Data Analyst to: Design, plan and deliver sustainable solutions using modern programming languages (Apache Spark 2.x, Databricks, SCALA) Provide technical expertise and recommendations in assessing new software projects and initiatives to support and enhance our existing applications Work with key stakeholders including business change teams and wider SMEs within CTB organizations in GCRG technology to identify and delivery on functional/System design, Data model / Data Quality Performance tuning improvement opportunities Use technical knowhow (Enterprise Architecture, Database, data model) to support Capability Change teams to design data models and ensure logical and physical data models are properly reflected in data model repository of GCRG (Enterprise architecture, DGP) Your team You’ll be working in the Group Compliance, Regulatory & Governance IT team based in Pune. Our role is to design and implement IT solutions for global Regulatory Reporting requirements (Major shareholding disclosures, Short Selling disclosures, 13F reporting, Conflict clearance, etc). We are a global IT team supporting internal clients throughout the world. Your expertise System Analyst / Big Data Engineer / Data Analyst focused on developing regulatory reporting solutions Strong experience with data warehousing, SQL, PL/SQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle databases Experience with Big Data technologies like Spark 2.0, SPARK SQL, Databricks using Scala or Python Well versed with working on Azure cloud platform. Good understanding of financial products and front to back trade lifecycle Experienced handling critical L3 support queries Design, plan and deliver solutions in a large-scale enterprise environment About us UBS is the world’s largest and only truly global wealth manager. We operate through four business divisions: Global Wealth Management, Personal & Corporate Banking, Asset Management and the Investment Bank. Our global reach and the breadth of our expertise set us apart from our competitors. With more than 70,000 employees, we have a presence in all major financial centers in more than 50 countries. Do you want to be one of us? Join us From gaining new experiences in different roles to acquiring fresh knowledge and skills, at UBS we know that great work is never done alone. We know that it's our people, with their unique backgrounds, skills, experience levels and interests, who drive our ongoing success. Together we’re more than ourselves. Ready to be part of #teamUBS and make an impact? Disclaimer / Policy Statements UBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce. Employees working from UBS Singapore offices must comply with Workforce Vaccination Measures as implemented by the Singapore government with effect from 1 January 2022, and other applicable safe management measures as may be amended from time to time.

Title: Data Analyst - Intern #Immediate
Description: Job Description We're Hiring! Aon is currently recruiting a Data Analyst- Intern to join our Health Solutions team in Singapore. About Aon Aon Plc is a leading global professional services firm providing a broad range of risk, retirement, and health solutions. Our 50,000 colleagues in 120 countries empower results for clients by using proprietary data and analytics to deliver insights that reduce volatility and improve performance. At Aon, you’ll be part of a team which will support and inspire you and provide the opportunities and resources to develop your skills. It’s an environment which encourages you to achieve your best - together we’ll empower results. Aon’s Centers for Innovation and Analytics in Singapore, Dublin and Krakow are at the heart of delivering Aon’s Data & Analytic Services team’s mission to: Accelerate the rate of innovation through digital solutions to help better respond to clients’ evolving needs Provide foundational data and analytics capabilities in one place for 50,000 Aon colleagues and our global clients who use our risk and people solutions Established in 2012, there are over 100 colleagues in Singapore’s Centre today including actuaries, software developers, data scientists, financial analysts and accountants. We are expanding rapidly and looking for dedicated individuals who can leverage emerging technologies and collaborate across Aon’s solution lines to help clients and colleagues make better, data-driven decisions today and tomorrow. As a Health Solutions Data Analytics Intern , you will assist to provide our consultants with analytical tools that support the consulting process around offering health and benefits (e.g., supporting life insurance, wellbeing programmes, actuarial pricing, insurance plan selection advice). Other responsibilities include: Interacting with internal stakeholders to develop solutions based on analytical requirements Building knowledge on regional insurance landscape, health, and wellness Providing support for internal stakeholders for external clients as a well as for the development of internal tools and intellectual capital Attaining functional knowledge on the use of ETL tools and Visualization tools Developing analytical models and insights and presentation to internal (team) and business stakeholders Requirements: Undergraduate with an expected graduation of the following calendar year / Entry level are welcome Degree in Quantitative Finance / Statistics / Analytics / Mathematics / Computer Science preferred Proficient in SQL and experience with R or Python to perform data querying, running data models and conducting data analysis Experience with visualization tools (e.g., PowerBI /Tableau) is a plus Proficient in Microsoft Office applications Good academic track record Involvement in extracurricular activities Strong passion for the consulting industry of Risk and People Strong business acumen Strong communication skills Ability to work in an ever-changing environment Ability to work on diverse teams and cultivate relationships Enthusiastic who like meeting people Creative thinking Positive attitude Confident, self-motivated, with the desire to learn

Title: Senior Livestream Business Data Analyst #JobsThatMatter #Seekbetter #UrgentHire
Description: Responsibilities About TikTok TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo. Why Join Us At TikTok, our people are humble, intelligent, compassionate and creative. We create to inspire - for you, for us, and for more than 1 billion users on our platform. We lead with curiosity and aim for the highest, never shying away from taking calculated risks and embracing ambiguity as it comes. Here, the opportunities are limitless for those who dare to pursue bold ideas that exist just beyond the boundary of possibility. Join us and make impact happen with a career at TikTok. About the team Livestream Team is committed to creating real-time interactive scenes, As a new form of content, livestream creates value for all parties in the ecology. Livestream provides users with a unique consumption experience and further generalizes content. It is also a new way of employment to provide more direct fan interaction and deepen relationships with authors; It provides healthy and objective revenue to the platform and promotes content exclusivity. It also serves as a "new infrastructure" for the expansion of ecological boundaries. Responsibilities Establish analytical framework for the TikTok Live streaming team: root cause analysis, core metrics monitoring, and automated dashboards to surface key data insights to stakeholders and inform product strategies. Evaluate and forecast the impact of product features on creators, agencies, operation and the TikTok ecosystem. Dive deep into the data to understand how creator, 3rd parties, and viewer behaviors change with the evolution of our product. Understand top performers and use data to explore and analyze actionable operational strategies. Act as our team's thought leader on best practices and move towards a long-term vision of sustainable and thriving data processes. Work hand-in-hand with operation, product, engineering, and design to proactively influence and inform teammates' decisions throughout the business lifecycle. Qualifications Bachelor degree or above, major in mathematics, statistics, computer science is preferred; or major in science or engineering or engaged in data statistics, analysis, modeling related working areas after graduation. 5+ years of domain experience in a mobile or consumer internet business, or in a high-velocity, high-growth product or team. Data analysis ability, familiar with Hive SQL, Python, R. Familiarity of machine learning Knowledge will be a plus. Familiar with statistics and dashboard, preferred to have experience in user growth, metrics creation, A/B testing, and data modeling. An impact-oriented, customer-centric approach to data analysis; Exceptional analysis, communication, and strategy report writing skills. Has a “can-do” attitude with a strong sense of ownership to execute end-to-end projects. Self-driven and able to manage and balance ongoing requests with proper prioritization. TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

Title: Product Manager
Description: Full Job Description PRIMARY Responsibilities Build Application capabilities for Labs to automate data analytics and Information Management Capability, through on time-delivery of reports, projects and continuous improvements Collaborate with Technology teams and offer creative solutions to the research teams to develop data modelling, data manipulation, aggregation and analysis of quantitative data; forecast and trending of performance data to derive actionable intelligence Participate in the whole life cycle of dashboard and analytics development from understanding needs through data sourcing, development of dashboards and analytics in Business Intelligence software Support both technical and functional managers for application development and analytics projects Contribute to the implementation of agile methodology of analytics and reporting development Assuring data integrity and effective reports validation Communicate with various stakeholders, such as: Product analysts, platform developers, project managers, etc. Duties Perform data extraction, cleaning, transformation for biological datasets. Build complete workflows and requirement specifications for Labs and Research systems Integrating external or new datasets into existing data pipelines. Analyse problems and engineer highly flexible solutions. Support and advise best practices in data management standards, policies, and procedures. Collaborate with Project Manager, Data Analyst, and Developers to identify data and application development approaches to build scalable data-driven products. Work in an Agile Environment that practices Continuous Integration and Delivery Background and Experience 3+ years working as a Data Analyst in a Biomedical / Bioinformatics environment (Exceptional freshers, will also be considered) Ability to translate department requirements to specifications for development SQL knowledge is required for this position Proficient knowledge in Excel is required Greatly preferred if the candidate has knowledge of various online survey platforms such as Qualtrics, RedCap Good logical and analytical thinking Adaptable, meticulous, innovative, independent, and self-motivated, with good problem-solving skills

Title: Data Solutions Manager*#UrgentHire #JobsThatMatter #WorkNow #JobsThatMatter
Description: Responsibilities About the team The success of TikTok's data business model hinges on the supply of a large volume of high quality labeled data that will grow exponentially as our business scales up. However, the current cost of data labeling is excessively high. The Data Solutions team is built to understand data strategically at scale for all Global Business Solution (GBS) business needs. Data Solutions Team uses quantitative and qualitative data to guide and uncover insights, turning our findings into real products to power exponential growth. Data Solutions Team responsibility includes infrastructure construction, recognition capabilities management, global labeling delivery management. About the role We're looking for a highly capable data solutions manager to build the next generation of data solutions in support of industry leading products and services in the space of Monetization and Integrity that TikTok provides. You will be assessing business needs, innovating across your given resources, and navigating across both business and technical XFN stakeholder teams. You will lead a team of 3-4 data analyst and data operations executives in building of cutting edge data solutions for large scale monetization and integrity products Design solutions to build data labeling at scale, using state-of-the-art algorithms (like active learning) and recognition models to improve datasets and optimize the requirement handling mechanism and process Drive analytics and insights to aid business decisions and the quantification impact of initiatives through scientific approaches (like experimental designs). Responsibility What you will do Work closely with stakeholders to capture requirements for data labeling projects Track the progress of data labeling projects and manage resources to ensure timely completion Develop strong relationships with XFN partner teams to deliver efficient data solutions that support revenue generation and cost savings Translating complex business requirements into technical product solutions Enhance on the service and quality of labelled data delivery Innovate across multiple different data product types to reduce cost and increase impact Utilize experience to recommend the right machine learning techniques to the appropriate business use-cases Experience the entire model pipeline from data gathering to model delivery and maintenance Qualifications What you will need Solid foundations of statistics and data science / analytics projects management is preferred Outstanding skills of communication, collaboration, project management, problem solving, and an excellent team player Strong interest in process optimization and improvement Highly conscientious with good attention to detail Experience in artificial intelligence, computer vision, and machine learning techniques and other fields are highly preferred Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent practical experience Experience with writing and optimizing SQL, and with one general purpose programming language (e.g., Java, C/C++, Python) Experience in data analytics and data visualization Experience in client facing roles / consulting preferred TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We believe individuals should not be disadvantaged because of their background or identity, but instead should be considered based on their strengths and experience. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

Title: Data Labelling Engineer | Yearly Contract
Company: PERSOLKELLY Singapore Pte Ltd (Formerly Kelly Services Singapore Pte Ltd)
Description: Job Responsibilities: Support data classification and taxonomy methods and standards, understand business, cooperate with data team. Support analysis, identification and marking various data samples in storage, and ensure accuracy and recall rate. Support R&D team to improve algorithm recognition and machine learning ability, analyze badcase of algorithm recommended data labels, put forward suggestions and basis for annotation/labelling, and participate in the discussion of algorithm model improvement solutions Deeply understand the business, investigate the data samples of each business line, and improve the classification standard of data labels and sample database Improve the data annotation operation process, optimize the label sampling and review mechanism, and improve the efficiency of manual standards Participate in the functional optimization design of the annotation platform Requirements: Majored in Computer Science or IT related, with research and development in testing, data analyst or DBA experience, familiar with all kinds of data samples in storage Excellent communication and analysis skills and good reasoning skills, able to quickly understand the business and judge the sample type according to the business attributes Be able to effectively do repetitive tasks and effectively with a minimum of errors Knowledge of artificial intelligence and machine learning. Interested candidates, click the "APPLY NOW" button Only shortlisted applications will be notified by our consultants. Title: IT Data Analyst | #Immediate #JobsThatMatter#
Description: Your role Are you interested in developing regulatory reporting solutions using the latest technologies? Are you confident at iteratively refining user requirements and removing any ambiguity? Do you like to be challenged and encouraged to learn and grow professionally? We are looking for IT Data Analyst to: Design, plan and deliver sustainable solutions using modern programming languages (Apache Spark 2.x, Databricks, SCALA) Provide technical expertise and recommendations in assessing new software projects and initiatives to support and enhance our existing applications Work with key stakeholders including business change teams and wider SMEs within CTB organizations in GCRG technology to identify and delivery on functional/System design, Data model / Data Quality Performance tuning improvement opportunities Use technical knowhow (Enterprise Architecture, Database, data model) to support Capability Change teams to design data models and ensure logical and physical data models are properly reflected in data model repository of GCRG (Enterprise architecture, DGP) Your team You’ll be working in the Group Compliance, Regulatory & Governance IT team based in Pune. Our role is to design and implement IT solutions for global Regulatory Reporting requirements (Major shareholding disclosures, Short Selling disclosures, 13F reporting, Conflict clearance, etc). We are a global IT team supporting internal clients throughout the world. Your expertise System Analyst / Big Data Engineer / Data Analyst focused on developing regulatory reporting solutions Strong experience with data warehousing, SQL, PL/SQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle databases Experience with Big Data technologies like Spark 2.0, SPARK SQL, Databricks using Scala or Python Well versed with working on Azure cloud platform. Good understanding of financial products and front to back trade lifecycle Experienced handling critical L3 support queries Design, plan and deliver solutions in a large-scale enterprise environment About us UBS is the world’s largest and only truly global wealth manager. We operate through four business divisions: Global Wealth Management, Personal & Corporate Banking, Asset Management and the Investment Bank. Our global reach and the breadth of our expertise set us apart from our competitors. With more than 70,000 employees, we have a presence in all major financial centers in more than 50 countries. Do you want to be one of us? Join us From gaining new experiences in different roles to acquiring fresh knowledge and skills, at UBS we know that great work is never done alone. We know that it's our people, with their unique backgrounds, skills, experience levels and interests, who drive our ongoing success. Together we’re more than ourselves. Ready to be part of #teamUBS and make an impact? Disclaimer / Policy Statements UBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce. Employees working from UBS Singapore offices must comply with Workforce Vaccination Measures as implemented by the Singapore government with effect from 1 January 2022, and other applicable safe management measures as may be amended from time to time.

Title: Production Planning Analyst [UP 5.3k/ US Tech MNC]
Description: We are looking for an junior experienced data analyst who is familiar with the production planning/supply chain space. Focus of the role: Data Entry, Production Planning, Inventory data Adecco is partnering our client, a leading technology company The Talent: Bachelor's degree preferred At least 2 years of experience in a supply chain / logistics coordination, working closely with data Intermediate proficiency with Microsoft Excel ( VLOOKUP Pivot Table ) Exposure to data centers a big plus Job Description Conduct production meetings with various stakeholders to understand and track changes to plans and execution and enable visibility into impacts to the business. Title: IT Data Analyst | #UrgentHire #Urgent#
Description: Your role Are you interested in developing regulatory reporting solutions using the latest technologies? Are you confident at iteratively refining user requirements and removing any ambiguity? Do you like to be challenged and encouraged to learn and grow professionally? We are looking for IT Data Analyst to: Design, plan and deliver sustainable solutions using modern programming languages (Apache Spark 2.x, Databricks, SCALA) Provide technical expertise and recommendations in assessing new software projects and initiatives to support and enhance our existing applications Work with key stakeholders including business change teams and wider SMEs within CTB organizations in GCRG technology to identify and delivery on functional/System design, Data model / Data Quality Performance tuning improvement opportunities Use technical knowhow (Enterprise Architecture, Database, data model) to support Capability Change teams to design data models and ensure logical and physical data models are properly reflected in data model repository of GCRG (Enterprise architecture, DGP) Your team You’ll be working in the Group Compliance, Regulatory & Governance IT team based in Pune. Our role is to design and implement IT solutions for global Regulatory Reporting requirements (Major shareholding disclosures, Short Selling disclosures, 13F reporting, Conflict clearance, etc). We are a global IT team supporting internal clients throughout the world. Your expertise System Analyst / Big Data Engineer / Data Analyst focused on developing regulatory reporting solutions Strong experience with data warehousing, SQL, PL/SQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle databases Experience with Big Data technologies like Spark 2.0, SPARK SQL, Databricks using Scala or Python Well versed with working on Azure cloud platform. Good understanding of financial products and front to back trade lifecycle Experienced handling critical L3 support queries Design, plan and deliver solutions in a large-scale enterprise environment About us UBS is the world’s largest and only truly global wealth manager. We operate through four business divisions: Global Wealth Management, Personal & Corporate Banking, Asset Management and the Investment Bank. Our global reach and the breadth of our expertise set us apart from our competitors. With more than 70,000 employees, we have a presence in all major financial centers in more than 50 countries. Do you want to be one of us? Join us From gaining new experiences in different roles to acquiring fresh knowledge and skills, at UBS we know that great work is never done alone. We know that it's our people, with their unique backgrounds, skills, experience levels and interests, who drive our ongoing success. Together we’re more than ourselves. Ready to be part of #teamUBS and make an impact? Disclaimer / Policy Statements UBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Title: Group Audit – Regional Data Analyst, AVP, #Immediate
Description: Details of the Division and Team: As Regional Data Analyst you will be a member of our Data Analytics Center of Excellence (CoE) for Group Audit. You will pioneer and support Group Audit in implementing innovative and effective analytics processes that are critical to the success of our audit function. Based in the Singapore office, you will work embedded in audit teams around the world, applying the latest analytics technologies while connecting with the central team in Germany to leverage our core analytics solutions. You will be responsible for supporting all Group Audit functions with data analytics services and audit automation solutions. What we will offer you: A healthy, engaged and well-supported workforce are better equipped to do their best work and, more importantly, enjoy their lives inside and outside the workplace. That’s why we are committed to providing an environment with your development and wellbeing at its center. You can expect: Flexible benefits plan including virtual doctor consultation services Comprehensive leave benefits Gender Neutral Parental Leave Flexible working arrangements 25 days of annual paid leave, plus public holiday & Flexible Working Arrangement Your key responsibilities: Evaluate data analytics requests and work collaboratively with auditors, data owners and developers to deliver working solutions and analytics in an agile and iterative manner. Identify data analytics opportunities and use cases, liaise with audit / investigation teams, and perform any advanced or specialized analytics work. Identify automation opportunities and develop solutions that simplify audit processes and make Group Audit more efficient. Driving innovation across Group Audit, leveraging the experience gained and data collected from successful data analytics projects. Promote the adoption and integration of data science into the Group Audit organization and inspire Group Audit colleagues by sharing background on successful adoption. Apply highest quality standards as your solutions will become an integral part of audit execution processes. Develop and present success stories to Group Audit management and internal stakeholders. Your skills and experience: A minimum of 3 years’ experience in a Data Analytics function within a financial institution Highly proficient with data analytic standards, methods and algorithms, including CI/CD cycle, SDLC/Continuous delivery part of Operation & Maintenance tasks Practical coding skills in Python, React/JS. SQL, SQL and supporting infrastructure (e.g. ML / NLP libraries) Highly proficient in data analytics tools and applications such as Tableau, Power Query, and Celonis Working knowledge in data science, big data tools and infrastructural components – GCP/ Hadoop / PySpark / Jupyter Data Preparation (SQL, HQL, ETL, Data Warehouse architecture, OLAP) Experience in applying data science techniques (advanced analytics, machine learning, statistics, text analysis, NLP, etc.) Able to solve real world problems as well as developing data analytics and automation solutions within the operational requirements of a global bank. Working knowledge of audit and audit functions within a financial institution Goal oriented and structured thinking with effective organizational skills as well as excellent communication skills with the ability to convey complex information in an understandable manner. A creative technologist passionate about data and information with an intrinsic motivation and curious to learn new technologies and frameworks to adopt data analytics for new ways of auditing. Master or bachelor’s degree (or equivalent) from an accredited college or university (or equivalent) in a quantitative field (Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Engineering, Computer Science, Economics, etc.) or equivalent work experience. Role is required to be performed on-site at One Raffles Quay office. Relevant vaccination requirement applies How we’ll support you: Flexible working to assist you balance your personal priorities Coaching and support from experts in your team A culture of continuous learning to aid progression A range of flexible benefits that you can tailor to suit your needs Training and development to help you excel in your career

Title: Operations Analyst #Urgent #WorkNow #UrgentHire #Immediate
Description: Responsibilities About TikTok TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo. Team Introduction Our Data-TnS-PUO Team is responsible for providing instant troubleshooting and consulting services to internal platform users. This position is mainly responsible for the following: receiving and resolving users' issues, communicating with our product and engineering teams, analyzing and providing the best solutions, maintaining the SOP, writing daily reports, following the escalation process, and providing top-quality user experiences. We are continually expanding this team in Singapore across multiple time zones to ensure user satisfaction and drive product optimization. The role: We are looking for an Operations Analyst to evaluate our team's operations and make recommendations to improve operational efficiency. To be successful as an operations analyst, you should be able to analyze complex data sets, identify shortcomings or opportunities, work closely with management and/or User Operations Specialists to understand data-related requirements, and implement changes. What you will be doing: Identify potential operational requirements and opportunities for improvement through data analysis. Determine appropriate methods to analyze operations, relevant information, and data. Working very closely with management and fulfilling data analyzing requirements from leaders. Analyze internal platform users' feedback data to build an in-depth understanding of our platforms and blend this analysis with further optimization points. Adapt analysis to the specific operational research questions and/or build-up forecasting models by using a range of data sources and research methodologies Partner with the engineering team to build up insights and complete bi-weekly data analysis reports Build internal operations data dashboard and provide constructive suggestions on tool optimisation. Assist and support training, quality auditing, and other users feedback projects Qualifications What you should have: Relevant Bachelor's degree in a business field with a focus on Quantitative / Research methods; or a Graduate degree's in Science, Mathematics, Operations, business, digital marketing or survey-based research methods is a plus 3+ years of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar position is required Proficient in Python and SQL to conduct statistical modeling or data analysis Excellent communication skills, verbal and written in both English and Chinese Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Strong multitasking and time management skills

Title: Data Analyst
Description: About us The Japan IPL Express family is a careful mashup of individual geniuses, who not only are dynamic and innovative, they live by the “work hard, play harder” anthem. Being highly customer-and-value-centric, we believe in only providing our customers with everything that they need, and never offering what they don’t. At our rapid rate of growth, our team is on a constant look-out for more like-minded troopers who possess a ‘can-do’ optimism to join us on our mission. If a dynamic, no corporate-BS environment is where you’d like to invest the next couple of years to learn, grow and make a true impact… We could be the perfect fit for you! About this role We are looking for a Data Analyst who has the ability to think ‘out of the box’ and translating data into simple human language and compelling visualizations (data storytelling), to empower the broader organization to understand and leverage data. Main responsibilities Collect and evaluate data on user demographics, preferences, behavior and needs to support the marketing team in campaigns and other brand objectives. Able to conduct good analysis and possess excellent data report presentation capabilities, able to think and analyze problems systematically. Design, build and enhance intuitive dashboards using data visualization tools for business to aid in portfolio management, strategy development & reporting. Crafting reports and presentations for management, with end to end ownership of presentation & also tracking of action plans. Leverage Digital Analytics to identify interactions, patterns, insights, and trends across user and system journey. Support operation team by evaluating data to create dashboard to improve operational efficiency. Compile and maintain marketing statistics and track marketing performance indicators. Provide analytics support to the relevant business units in driving better understanding of customer journey, conversion & optimization opportunities to achieve strategic goals. Develop dashboards for internal stakeholders on user acquisition, retention, marketing campaign effectiveness, promo utilization, and more. Requirements Minimum 3-5 years of relevant work experience. Experience in programming or analytic tools such as SQL, VBA, Python, Google Data Studio, Tableau, Business Bi. Meticulous and possess strong execution ability Strong data manipulation and analysis skills Ability to collect, clean, transform and analyze large amounts of data efficiently with attention to detail and accuracy Strong mathematical or statistics background with Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Business or Economics. Strong presentation and communication skills to deal with a broad set of stakeholders, ability to tell a story through data, identify opportunities and drive action plans. The Environment We Offer Positive and nurturing work environment where people all are happy with their job, excited to come work, feeling safe and comfortable. Our vision of a great workplace is not great perks (although we have many), it’s about investing in our team of talented people who are excited to pursue shared goals. The Benefits We Offer Flexible working hours because we are not joking when it comes to improving work-life balance. On top of basic annual leaves, we also include birthday & marriage leaves. Medical and dental coverage Annual Health Screening Unlimited supply of snacks and drinks from our pantry and Foodpanda credits. While we take care of your pocket and tummy, we have to take care of your mental and physical well being and that’s why we provide monthly classpass credits. (Go for some yoga class, meditating class, boxing class etc.) Free monthly IPL shots!

Title: Business Analyst, Digital & Emerging Payments #Immediate
Description: Job summary Job Description This role is based in Singapore. As a Business Analyst on the Amazon Payments Marketing team you will own analytics for our emerging business efforts. Your primary focus will be leveraging your passion for digging into data, structuring problems, and building analyses to identify actionable insights from application data and digital marketing channels, both on Amazon and off. You enjoy being creative in your use of data-driven tools and methodologies to understand marketing levers and are eager to initiate new ideas, approaches and actions to move the business forward. Key job responsibilities: You will own reporting and insights to identify and evaluate opportunities to drive funnel conversion. Develop and streamline necessary dashboards and one-off analyses, providing ability to surface business critical KPIs, monitor the health of marketing channels and effectively communicate performance. Partner with stakeholders and Business Intelligence teams to acquire necessary data for robust analysis. Convert data into insights including implications and recommendations that are specific and actionable for the Marketing team and across the business. Partner with other analysts as well as data engineering and technology teams to support building a best-in-class marketing platform and data infrastructure. Work with stakeholders to identify key metrics used to evaluate marketing performance. Identify, implement, and analyze a/b tests and campaigns. Use customer centric data analysis, data visualization, segmentation and a/b testing to optimize across channels and within campaigns. Stay current on best practice in Marketing Analytics methodologies and trends. Communicate insights using data visualization and presentations to stakeholders. BASIC QUALIFICATIONS Excited to analyze and explore large data! You will have the opportunity to give potentially game-changing recommendations to the business Data analysis experience (in a business or academic research setting) involving making hypotheses, accessing and prepping data and drawing actionable insights Bachelor’s or Master’s degree with analytical/ technical elements for eg. Computer Science, Engineering, Operations Research, Math, Statistics, Finance, Economics or similar Proficiency in data mining, analyzing big data using SQL ,reporting through excel and data visualization tools (such as Quicksight, Tableau or Qlik) Great verbal and written communication skills to influence your stakeholders and manage expectations Excellent time management skills PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS 3+ years of relevant experience in a business analyst, data analyst or statistical analysis role Understanding of data warehousing, designing table/views and optimizing queries. eCommerce experience and/or experience working with a Marketing team Experience in one or more scripting languages (e.g. Python, R, Shell)

Title: Senior IT Business & Data Analyst
Description: Roles & Responsibilities Job Purpose This role is expected to perform both as Business and Data Analyst, and is part of the IT Team based at the Singapore Aseptics Manufacturing facility. As IT Business Analyst, you are expected to provide IT business systems expertise implement and roll out service/system that meets business requirement through your indepth knowledge of the system capabilities as well as the business processes and workflows. And provide post implementation system/service operations and management throughout the lifecycle of the service/system. As IT Data Analyst, you will play a key role in pioneering the manufacturing facility’s data initiatives. You are expected to design, implement, roll out and maintain scalable analytics solution to empower business operations and drive business performance. Responsibilities Develop and enhance relationships with business SMEs (Subject Matter Expert) and local key stakeholders, acting as a trusted advisor/key point of contact, actively managing expectations and monitoring satisfaction levels and service adoption Analyzes business and technical processes to formulate and implement new/enhanced systems or technology roadmaps that meet business needs and objectives. Support as the technical SME in the follow on activities to define business case, get endorsement and delivery. Proactively identify and execute improvements/simplifications of the IT business systems, delivering the set annual financial objectives for the business or IT. Provide expertise and translate the business needs to design, build and implement insightful and commercially beneficial dashboards and reports with Tableau and internal BI tools to empower business insights and visualization, and drive business performance. Supports collaboration within and across teams to identify opportunities and synergies at the local level Responsible for the day-to-day operations and management of the service/system(s), ensuring that they are stable, has business continuity (as appropriate), running with minimal disruption to manufacturing operations, and maintained in a validated state. Operational and management tasks includes and not limited to the following: capacity, incident, problem, change, patch and lifecycle management drafts and maintains IT operational procedures supports crisis management (including priority 1/2 IT incidents) with relevant stakeholders and Head of IT, if required maintain and ensure all application data is consistent across the various repositories Ensure adherence to IT, security and compliance standards/requirement set out and defined by external regulatory bodies, Alcon IT and/or Quality Organization. Tasks includes and not limited to the following: supports gap assessments. proposes and aligns with Head of IT on appropriate action to address the gaps Education Degree in Information Technology (Information Systems, Computer Science, Business Analytics) or equivalent technology related field. Experience: Minimum: 4+ years in an IT Business Analyst or equivalent position preferably in manufacturing environment, and 2+ years experience in data analysis/data warehouse/mart and reporting development Hands-on experience and knowledge in using data visualization and reporting technologies such as Tableau and Cognos BI and ETL tools is a must. Experience in full implementation of small-mid scale IT systems as Technical SME / Project Manager Experience in full implementation of BI / Data Visualization solution as Technical SME Experience and knowledge in working with S3 AWS preferred Solid knowledge and/or experience in scripting and programming (eg. Python), query languages, and data management experience Core Competencies: Self-starter, able to work independently with minimal guidance, and proven ability to roll up their sleeves and contribute quickly. Highly motivated with a strong sense of ownership and bold to challenge norms Outstanding qualities such as leadership, adaptability, integrity, strong organizational skills and team player spirit Excellent analytical, problem-solving, listening, influencing and communication skills and ability to partner with stakeholders/SMEs across all levels of the organization and cross-functionally

Title: Data Analyst Risk Management - All Gender #JobsThatMatter
Description: ABOUT THE JOB Job title: Sanofi Risk Management Analyst Lead Grade/Level: Grade L3.2 Hiring Manager: Yves Cocaign Location: Paris or Singapore 20 % Remote working and 20% of travel expected Job Type: Permanent, Full time Our Team Sanofi Internal Audit (SIA) and Risk Management (RM) reports to the Chief Executive Officer and the Chairman of the Audit Committee. Sanofi Risk Management is responsible for the design, maintenance, and dissemination of the enterprise risk management program that enables management of operations and functions to identify and respond to the most significant risks relevant to their area of responsibility. Sanofi Risk Management team coordinates a network of risk managers in the various Global Business Units and Functions and helps the risk leaders and risk sponsors to structure their risk mitigation programs and follow-up indicators. Sanofi Risk Management enables the Audit Committee to fulfil its obligations under the rules of the Board of Directors by reporting Sanofi’s risk management activities and risk profile periodically as agreed with the Committee. Job Description Reporting solid line to the ‘SIA Digitalization and Data Analytics Head’, the ‘Risk Management Data Analyst Lead’ will actively contribute to the development and implementation of Data Analytical and Digitalization activities in Risk Management by supporting the Risk Management team. He/She will support the Risk Management team in Data Management by identifying Sustainable sources of information across Sanofi organization that can be leveraged to allow monitoring of Sanofi significant risks Meaningful sources of information outside of Sanofi to allow a better understanding of Sanofi environment in relation to significant Sanofi risks Information already existing or under construction assets such as the Snowflake data lake He/She will design and deliver the Risks Management Digital Roadmap by Delivering the roadmap in coordination with the RM team Ensuring a strong alignment with the Sanofi data roadmap and SIA Digital roadmap He/She will be a key enabler of a data-driven Culture Change by Understanding the current challenges in Risk monitoring Building consistent, trustable, and sustainable monitoring of identified risks based on existing data within Sanofi He/She will be an innovation enabler by Scouting best practices across Sanofi and from external sources such as our peers, professional forums, and events Keeping in mind state of the art in terms of Digital Risk Management best practices, such as ‘artificial intelligence’, ‘predictive analytics’, ‘machine learning’ for future usage Finally, he/she should act as a mentor and trainer to all Risks Managers within the Sanofi Risk Management network to develop data analytics expertise. Key objectives are Drive data analytics activities at RM Team level Actively participate to the RM activities Participate and contribute actively to ensure a coordination of global data analytics activities within Sanofi Internal Audit & Risk Management Develop Data Analytics related support for and adherence of the Risks Managers ABOUT YOU In addition to strong capabilities in Data Analytics field, the ideal candidate for this position should demonstrate the following behaviours Listening abilities Focused on internal stakeholders but open to external network Team player Establish and develop relationships with key stakeholders in his/her scope of responsibility Effective communication Analysis, synthesis, and communication skills (oral and written) English is our common language Sense of confidentiality Ability to partner with Business stakeholders Teaching and coaching abilities Autonomy and independence of judgement Anticipation of risks and mandatory resources Objectivity and thoroughness Organization and planning skills Ability to adapt/adjust to a multicultural environment Sense of service Education and work experience A minimum of a bachelor’s degree is required A minimum of six years of professional work experience is required, ideally with at least 2 years of experience in relation to audit, internal control, or risk management Previous hands-on experience using BI tools such as Power BI, Qlik, Tableau, Alteryx or SQL, and SAP is required Previous experience with Data analytics is required In-depth knowledge of SAP (data structure, tables, fields, and process) is highly recommended Knowledge of Sanofi data landscape is highly recommended Excellent verbal and presentation skills are required Pursue progress, discover extraordinary. Better is out there. Better medications, better outcomes, better science. But progress doesn’t happen without people – people from different backgrounds, in different locations, doing different roles, all united by one thing: a desire to make miracles happen. So, let’s be those people. Sanofi Inc. and its U.S. affiliates are Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employers committed to a culturally diverse workforce. Watch our ALL IN video and check out our Diversity, Equity and Inclusion actions at sanofi.com! At Sanofi diversity and inclusion is foundational to how we operate and embedded in our Core Values. We recognize to truly tap into the richness diversity brings we must lead with inclusion and have a workplace where those differences can thrive and be leveraged to empower the lives of our colleagues, patients and customers.
